number of helpful: 7 of 10 people (70%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 20
												Imagine... Red Orchestra 2 and Battlefield had a child. That would be Insurgency. Insurgency is a highly realistic modern shooter that shines through it's simple, yet effective gameplay basics. Choose a class, invest x points into your weapons, attachements and equipement, spawn into the game, follow the objective. No unnecessary hud, no unlockables, no levels, nothing. Just pure multiplayer fun. Having various different gamemodes in both, PvP and PvE, every kind of audience will be able to enjoy the game. Defending against waves of enemies, pushing through their lines, fighting players in close combat, simulating warfare in cities - there are countless options. The customization is a bigbig plus. You can adjust every class to your needs - some better than others, but all are very versatile. A huge range of weapons (AK, M4, Mosin Nagant, Revolver, M14, AKu, Mp40, ...) and a bunch of attachements liek red dots, silencer, grips etc. allow you to choose what fits you best. The gunplay is highly realistic. High recoil, high damage and a properly working cover system make gunfights very fun! The steam workshop is very active in creating lots and lots of skins to use for your guns - free of charge. Want something different? Go get it! Overall: Recommended. Insurgency is a game for people who enjoy hardcore PvE / PvP fights and can adapt to situations well. This is not a game for Call of Duty fans or alike - Casuals better stay away.

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												This game can easily compete with the top FPS games out today.It is geared towards squad based gameplay and is set on a 'Hardcore' setting.It has a fresh gamemode that is similar to domination fused with search and destroy.It is similar to Red Orchestra, with modern warfare elements.The bullet hit is dead on; rarely have I been cheated out of a kill due to lag and/or those 'annoying moments' when you think you shot them and you really didn't.There is no 'level up' system, instead you are given points for doing well in-game. You can use these points to put attachments on your weapon. *PLEASE READ*THIS GAME IS NOT FOR THE FAINT OF HEART. IT IS NOT FOR 5 YEAR OLD CHILDREN.It is a tactical shooter; It is squad based. There is no room for drop shots, quick scopes or noobtoobs.It uses the valve source dedicated servers, so those of you that enjoy source games and the support. This game is for you.The game is incredibly well made even though it is in the Early Access phase. I'm glad I made this purchase. I will for sure drop Battlefield 4 and put time into this one.

content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												If you like Adult Hide & Seek combined with a cup of "Gun Porn" -then this game is a must have.After "Role Playing" a bit, you soon realize that working together as a Squad helps you and your whole Team big time. If the Squad knows which Equipment to choose and the Leader knows which Orders he should give- Oh boy! The immersion kicks in your face and suddenly dying seems like a very bad thing. Not many game's actually accomplished this, not even those true "Realism Shooters". Sometimes (and especially in this scenario) is using voice-communication a great way to dive into a game.Did i mention that this game is 30% Gun-Porn? No? Well it is! The Weapons just feel like Weapons- not Airsoft-guns (yes, im looking at you CS:GO [96 Dmg in 6 Shots].) They actually shot where you point, you are aware of the different Gun-Sounds all the time (because ignoring enemy fire is just stupid) AND THE BEST PART: you don't even want all the attachments on your gun! Looking at a AK 47 with just a foregrip never felt better!I hope you can forgive me for not even mentioning one bad point, but i just can't see any.I can't even complain about un-added Features, because all the thing that matter have already been promised and are on the way or are already implemented.It's been ages since i sucked a games *ick that much, and i know it sounds a bit wierd- but believe me: Buy it and get ready to fall on your knee's.Early Access is not always bad, and Insurgency is the best example.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												MehWas a much much better game 4 months ago. Now with the re implementaion of C4, class restrictions that make no f**king sense whatsoever, game modes that do nothing to promote teamwork, a convuluted UI and a**â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥the HUD it's just another run of the mill generic shooter. It's worth the money just to mod the theater files if you're going to host or buy a server, but I no longer find it fun to play. It's beginning to remind me of Battlefield Play4Free where the game has serious issues that need addressed but they're more concerned with leaving it broken just to add more content.This from the forums"They took all the good features from America's army..."False. There is no teamwork. There is no BFT. There is no incapacitation. You can jump but you can't vault. Weapons models are incorrect. Loadouts are completely unrealistic, why can I choose a frag or smoke but not both? No ES2 objects to report. No bleeding or damage system requiring teammates to give you first aid to promote teamwork. I could go on and on about how this has nothing in common with America's Army.Another one"Notice: Teamwork requiredThis is a great tactical shooter. It's not so fun when no one cooperates. Work together!"Exactly my point. If there was any teamwork in this game I'd still be playing with over 945 hours logged regardless of the other issues I have with the game. Teamwork trumps everything else.Then there is also the matter of certain developers trolling players in public servers. Not only is it quite unprofessional when you do it wearing a bigass tag next to your name saying DEVELOPER but it puts both the game and the rest of the development team in a really bad light. Same thing applies to asking how to correctly implement a feature that is publicly released from the internal beta branch testing and the only reply is "that's not how you do it". That's not a â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥ answer. If it isn't the correct way to do it explain how to do it correctly so you do not need modify the default game theater files to keep clients from crashing when they join your server. All in all the game started out awesome. I can honestly say I thoroughly enjoyed playing it every day. Now that's not the case. Playing for more than 5 or 10 minutes seems like a chore instead of an escape. Any criticism of the game is swiftly met with deleted posts or temporary bans and feedback from a large portion of the community seems ignored in favor of making the game more and more noob friendly for players who might buy the game and play maybe 10 to 25 hours before moving on to something else. I don't see the community having any kind of longevity and it's a shame given the remarkable start this game had for a small indie team.EDIT:After playing Firefight tonight and seeing the teamwork that's still there (maybe it's just that mode) and the influx of new players I changed this to RECOMMENDED. The game is fun when you have people working together. The game is a hell of a lot of fun then. I had thought that was gone forever but I'll be the first to admit I might have jumped the gun. After all, there's gotta be something to this game or I'd have never racked up this many hours in the first place.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
Brief ReviewWhile multiplayer shooters are in great abundance these days, the small scale, squad based tactical shooter has been MIA for some time. The series filling this niche that rose and fell in the late 90's and early 2000's like Rainbow Six, SOCOM and Ghost Recon changed with the times, leaving in their wake a demand for a style of gameplay that is largely absent from the impressive yet largely samey environment of competitive online shooters today. Insurgency looks to fill this gap by taking the lethality and realism of games like Red Orchestra or Arma and distilling it down to the most basic components in maps and modes that wouldn't feel alien to a Counter-strike player. Make no mistake though, while it may look like a Counter-strike clone at a glance, Insurgency feels more like the tactical shooters of old, making it a surprisingly fresh experience.Pros and ConsProsThoughtful shootingA true test of skill vs. skillLots of customizationPlenty of modesIntense, methodical pacingGreat focus on teamworkConsDated visualsLethargic movement undersells the intensity (I understand why its like this)An EndingLike Counterstrike but with more bullet damage

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 6, 2015
												Its like a scaled-down version of Battlefield, only much more fun, doesn't have that sour EA aftertaste, and actually requires tactics compared to most of the traditional MP shooters out there. It also has PvE that you can play with other people, so there's a bit of variety to be had. The cheatingly accurate AI (who is guaranteed to kill you in less than 3 shots the moment he sights you down) will give you a run for your money; so staying in strategic cover and taking accurate shots is pretty much a requirement.Its not a heavily realistic shooter like ARMA or the pre-Vegas Rainbow Six games, but does add a lot of other factors that makes shooting a gun a lot more complex than a simple point-and-shoot deal like in CS or CoD. Much like the former games mentioned, there is no health counter; all it takes to kill you is 1-2 shots to the body and no amount of kevlar can help you survive a clean headshot. Body armor helps, but they're not completely reliable. You have no ammo counter, just a count of how many mags you got for one weapon, so you have to get a feel for your weapon to know how many are left in the magazine (Though it kinda doesn't help that the game doesn't have any stats for guns in-game). Knives don't help you run faster, be smart with your loadout and carry light gear to be fast or carry heavy gear to be well prepared. Its warfare as realistic and fun as it can be. Each class does get their own set of guns (which is disappointingly limited), but workable and you can still customize your gun to an extent to fit your playstyle. Mods also aren't given out like candy. You have limited supplies for mods so tooling up your gun is more of a tactical choice than a tacticool one. Guns also sound and feel pretty solid that you'll have fun shooting them at the enemy.Overall, not bad at all to play if you're looking for an affordable breath of fresh air in the saturated FPS market. Think of it as an infantry-only ARMA 2, but more action-ish.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												Gun play is very different from most traditional FPS titles. Many people will say that there is barely any hud at all but really there are still plenty of crucial elements on it. Objective markers, where squad mates are, magazine count and a side bar when you're switching weapons. It adds a little bit of a challenge but not having a bullet counter is something that takes little time to get used to any way. I can't speak for everyone but I barely pay attention to mine in most shooters but I digress.Your weapon moves a bit more independently from your camera so if youre one of those people who likes to sprint and around and hip fire for that quick XP you'll be a bit dissapointed. Aiming down sights is crucial to landing good shots and sprinting in any kind of hotzone is just silly unless is keeping your from getting shot. All of the weapons except for rockets and grenades are ray tracing just like any other source game so there's no need to worry about aiming ahead or accounting for bullet drop, none of that is there as far as I know.There are various classes with a decent range of armaments from machine guns to sniper riffles with a weight system so you can't load up on flash bangs with a silencer on your pistol and a decked out riffle. But getting used to this system does not take long and a little experimenting lets you figure out what the optimal set up is for your class. Don't be the â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥ who plays demo for the rocktes and then just tosses it in the first thirty seconds hoping to mimic the AI on a hunt map. Imitating AI Satan does not make you Satan.AI are actually pretty smart and are terrifying at times, decent at laying down supressing fire and keeping you on your toes. They're somewhere between a new human player and a Counter Strike bot as far as actions go. Have fun on hunt maps with friends at night. Arguably the most fun I've had on the game.There are plenty of other game modes besides hunt. Push is the best one for newer players as it plays like a wave based COD with an attack and deffend twist. It doesnt get tiring at all really. Most other game modes have more punishing aspects like no respawns or the defending team has fewer waves than the attacking.Sound is pretty good. I can't say there isn't really a weapon that sounds horrible. The first mod I got off of the workshop was the realism sound mod for weapons. Never looked back. Just watch your volume when you fire an RPK, those â¥â¥â¥â¥ers are loud. Character dialogue doesn't have to much going for it, it's a drier version of battlefield's in comparison. It is funny selecting "negative" in the radial menu as the security forces and having your guy yell "â¥â¥â¥â¥ NO". I can't really say how many times that's given me away and gotten me killed. Worth it.Visually speaking, it's a bit dated. It is a counter strike mod originally so you can get a decent idea of how it looks. Have a good machine to run it on higher settings to get something that looks like less like a source game. Watch your Lens FX quality in the options as well. That is a frame rate killer on weapon machines if you're using a sight on higher settings.Overall it's a solid 8/10. There are a handful of things that could be polished (look at the terrorist models and you'll see) but regardless of it's older visuals it's satisfying and the community is growing quite a bit.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2015
												This game is a perfect mix between the Arma and Battlefield series (even if only infantry based), it is full of different and fun pvp game modes, all based around territory control, hunt & destroy objectives, escort and obviously the classics like team deathmatch. The interesting aspect is that it also comes with a full coop team based option, where cooperation and teamplay are fundamental against rather smart and deadly AI enemies.Realism is not far away in Insurgency, one or two bullets put you down on the ground and while gameplay is still pretty frantic, you need to move cautiously around every corner, looking everywhere and listening to every sound clue possible, above all during night missions. You can customize your equipment in every little aspect, from weapon attachments to accessories like granades and night vision goggles, but you also need to keep an eye to your overall weight, based on the kind of mobility you want to have on the battlefield.Technically the game is rather good, graphics/effects are not that far from nowadays triple A titles and levels/maps are pretty well built. Sound design is top notch and you'llâ¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥yourself out when you'll hear bullets coming your way, but you'll also grin like a little Rambo when you'll hear the power of a full M249 magazine discharge...really great!I don't have particular issues to point out about Insurgency, it always played smooth and I had fun during all my time with it (and will keep playing it in the future). Compared to other FPS communities, players are always willing to play like a team and rarely opt for a mad mercenary approach, putting this game between the top spots of the military/tactical shooter genre. And its developers keep working on it sending out free upgrades and new maps/weapons/modes. Recommended, without a doubt!!

content:
Posted: April 9, 2016
												Fun multiplayer shooter. Sort of a mix between Battlefield series and Call of Duty series. Looks similar to COD's Hardcore mode - minimal UI (no ammo counter, no health, no map ect), friendly fire is always on, hard to tell friend or foe at a glance. But has lots of players, like Battlefield. There are no killstreaks, only you, your enemy and your objective. And you can only see kill/death ratio when you're dead. Respawn also happens in waves, like BF, but maps are smaller, closer to COD style.There's almost no single player mode. There's "tutorial" mode, where the game explains how to play, and there's "solo" mode, which is rather hard (your ally bots are rather stupid).There's a "co-op" mode, where a team of real players plays against bots to reach certain objectives, and bots vary in difficulty - from tough to insane.And there's good old multiplayer. Kind of fun, but personally I prefer CS:GO multiplayer. Its much more action-packed and looks better. More vibrant. But thats just a personal preference, Insurgency's multiplayer is more dark, but it grows on you. Its not a masterpiece, but not a complete disaster, either. Overall, Insurgency is a good game to try if you like multiplayer shooters, geared towards realism.

content:
Posted: October 19, 2015
												The co-op is fun.  Checkpoint is slow, coordinated room-clearing.  Survival is really fun on maps that aren't wide open.  Hunt is also fun on enclosed maps.  (Bots see in the dark and can also see you and kill you from miles away.)The PvP is really boring, most of your kills will be shooting people in the back, or people that were looking the other way, or people that were just sprinting and can't get their gun up in time, or using an RPG.  It's not like in Counter-Strike where there's the tactical element, but most of the battles are two people shooting each other at the same time.  The person that camps the longest, finds a really good spot to headglitch, or sits at the back of the map with a sniper rifle is the one to get the kills.  Most of my deaths were frustrating, being shot by someone I couldn't see or could barely see.  Most of my kills felt cheap and not rewarding.Not for everyone, but it's pretty good.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
												Insurgency is a fun and addicting semi-realistic FPS, with a prominent focus on teamwork. It basically has it all; Good graphics, intense gameplay, large selection of maps, etc.   Insurgency adds realistic elements to the gameplay, including limited hud, no killcams, reduced ability of the player to survive multiple gunshot wounds, etc.   It is quite an intense game. The feeling of adrenaline you get when you're pinned down by enemy fire, trying your best to stay alive is what makes this game truly shine. Now, what it lacks in quantity it makes up for in quality. There aren't a whole  lot of weapons, but the game makes up for that in the quality of them. Most guns (excluding the sniper rifles and pistols) have the option of changing their fire mode. Usually the choices are Semi, Burst, and Auto, so you can choose whichever works best for you.   Since Insurgency is semi-realistic, you the player can die in just a blink of an eye. It only takes 2-3 shots and you're dead. It only takes one stray RPG rocket to take you and your whole team out. In this game, you are not a walking tank that games like Call of Duty make you out to be. In order to survive, you need to work with your teammates to finish the mission.   The game's Online community is usually pretty active, so you shouldn't have too much trouble finding some teammates to pair up with. In general, if you're a fan of games like ArmA and Rainbow Six, definitely check this game out.Pros: - Good graphics- Large variety of maps- Semi-Realistic gameplay- Active communityCons:- Can be frustrating, especially if playing by yourself- Rather small selection of weaponsFinal Rating: 8.5/10

content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												Thought u were THE PLAYER in BF/COD.NOW be prepared to DIE. ALOT. LONE WOLF PWNER? YEAH try that then sit for 15 minutes and watch your mates die. AWESOME. This games brings back teamwork in a way that BF has lost, and COD never had. (yes ive been a LONG time player of both).  It's serious, slightly fun and at times, hard work. One shot to die. Long time to sit it out. Pressure on you when you get the 'last man standing' warning, as you have the chance to respawn the whole team. CHeck the corners, reload asap, look behind. This game is *&^&%&@!! hard, and TBH most of us playing it love it. Sure, the graphics are 2005, the animations are 2001 but the weapon sounds, the balance, the teamwork is what we all wanted in the AAA titles. I for one dont want 16 different grips, 45 different weapons, 55 different camo's etc. OVERIT. â¥â¥â¥â¥ that give us a simple choice, keep it balanced and let skill decide the game YEAH? I died alot in the beginning, but with time and a good squad or two, oh the joy. As a long time advocate of BFBC2, this game reminds what devs can do to bring back simpilicity, TEAMWORK and awesome fun times all at once. BEWARE no killcam, no HUD, no MAG COUNT. Awesome again. Its hard and its challenging BUT that kill, that POINT CAP, can be soooo >>>REWARDING<<< because, you actually earnt it.This game is a good balance between ARMA, BF. CS and RO. Can't recommend highly enough for those in the FPS community who are looking for an extra challenge. You'll mostly find a good community of players who understand Friendly Fire, Teamwork and VoiceChat as you'll need all to succeed :PEnjoy

content:
Posted: February 6, 2015
												Its like a scaled-down version of Battlefield, only much more fun, doesn't have that sour EA aftertaste, and actually requires tactics compared to most of the traditional MP shooters out there. It also has PvE that you can play with other people, so there's a bit of variety to be had. The cheatingly accurate AI (who is guaranteed to kill you in less than 3 shots the moment he sights you down) will give you a run for your money; so staying in strategic cover and taking accurate shots is pretty much a requirement.Its not a heavily realistic shooter like ARMA or the pre-Vegas Rainbow Six games, but does add a lot of other factors that makes shooting a gun a lot more complex than a simple point-and-shoot deal like in CS or CoD. Much like the former games mentioned, there is no health counter; all it takes to kill you is 1-2 shots to the body and no amount of kevlar can help you survive a clean headshot. Body armor helps, but they're not completely reliable. You have no ammo counter, just a count of how many mags you got for one weapon, so you have to get a feel for your weapon to know how many are left in the magazine (Though it kinda doesn't help that the game doesn't have any stats for guns in-game). Knives don't help you run faster, be smart with your loadout and carry light gear to be fast or carry heavy gear to be well prepared. Its warfare as realistic and fun as it can be. Each class does get their own set of guns (which is disappointingly limited), but workable and you can still customize your gun to an extent to fit your playstyle. Mods also aren't given out like candy. You have limited supplies for mods so tooling up your gun is more of a tactical choice than a tacticool one. Guns also sound and feel pretty solid that you'll have fun shooting them at the enemy.Overall, not bad at all to play if you're looking for an affordable breath of fresh air in the saturated FPS market. Think of it as an infantry-only ARMA 2, but more action-ish.

content:
Posted: August 12, 2014
 INSURGENCY [/tr] Developer New World Interactive Release Date January 22nd, 2014 Genre Tactical, First Person Shooter Mode(s) Online MultiplayerInsurgency is the sequel to the 2007 Source Engine mod, Insurgency: Modern Infantry Combat. This review is NOT for the mod.     TLDR VersionInsurgency is an adreneline fueled tactical multiplayer shooter that will have you making tactical decisions, matches escalate from organised pushes into objective territory to organised chaos of fast paced close quarters engagments. Game gets frequent free add-on content so it's a pretty good deal. Also you can die really fast but so do bad guys so it feels like you really are accomplishing somehing, in other words you get better the more you play. 11/10_Bretty Gud.          Insurgency is a multiplayer team-based game in which players take the role of Security Forces or Insurgent Forces, the game includes several objective oriented rule sets which each team attempts to complete. Most PvP modes consist of variations on capture and hold objectives where the teams attempt to move into the objective area and hold position in the area until it is captured; the ultimate goal is to hold all of the areas. Carrying over from the mod is the 'Push' game mode, an attack and defense game mode were one team must move in and capture a number of areas in a set order while the other team defends the position attempting to drain the attackers of their reinforcement waves.On the less competitive side is an adictive Co-Operative mode in which a small group of players work together to battle AI insurgents and capture areas as well as hunt and destroy their weapons caches.     Infantry combat is the core focus of the game, but make no mistake this isn't your standard shooter affair. Bullets pack a real punch and the damage system is universal, you can almost always takeout a player with one or two well placed shots and that applies to you as well. The matches in this game often work from careful advances towards objectives before erupting into deadly firefights with gun fire and explosions,  the excellent map design  really gets shown off here, in general there is always more than one way to reach a position and there is nothing quite like working your way around the flank of a position carefully scanning for targets while another group of players are in a heated battle; you go from that subtle approach and then burst into a fast paced assault on the capture point. There is a good selection of weapons and equipment which can be fitted to your liking as long as you have enough supply points, during a match you will earn supply points by helping complete objectives and helping your team. You also have two types of armor (effective against a few more shots from certain weapon calibres) but your choice ultimately effects your movement speed in some way.Maps are mainly focused around urban areas with some exceptions being a snowy mountain top village, the approach across a large bridge into a dense patch of buildings and an assault along a highway as you narrowly escape death by using abbandoned vehicles as cover. Don't get the wrong idea, although many of the maps are in urban cities they are all unique, each with defining characteristics. Revolt is a seaside city with dense building interiors and streets littered with debris from explosions while District has you in twitchy firefights through the alleyways on two sides of an open boulevard prime for marksmen to take shots at unlucky players. The map design is really some of the greatest I've personally seen and since the game supports Workshop mods some servers run custom ones.Since the release of this game three major updates have been released (there have been other patches of course) and with each came new weapons, equipment and official maps & game modes, most recently was the implementation of stats tracking system along with the main menu UI displaying the insurgency news feed so that players can stay connected. Finally what makes this game so great is the communication between developers and players, the beta client is also availble with the purchase of Insurgency where the devs have open beta tests of new maps, modes and weapons and listen to the player feedback and also play the game with you. To wrap this up I would highly reccomend Insurgency to anyone who is looking for a satisfying tactical online shooter experience that is both very accessible and challenging with a pay off for success that is undeniably one you earned

content:
Posted: October 19, 2014
												10/10. This is an awesome game. I'll be honest it looked a little cheesy at first, but once you play it, gosh man this game is harsh.  You really have to play it safe, or youâll get your head shot off. Even the AI is great, always trying to outflank you, and Iâll tell you, for a bunch of untrained rebels they can really shoot. Story time: So we're all in this objective and the enemy is counter-attacking us. Bullets are flying through the windows, so we all hit the deck. Theyâre downstairs too, so weâre stuck upstairs in our little room. Someone gets smart and sticks his head in the window, only to get it shot off. At this point an RPG comes in right where he just stood, explodes inside, and kills our entire team. Also the game has sound delay, the explosions sound a couple seconds off depending on distance, very pleasing. Youâll learn very quickly not to go near windows, or stay in a group of 2 or more, or get cornered in a room, those RPGs are murderous, however realistic. The game is well balanced, always interesting. At time is feels like the guns are a little unbalanced, the RPG for example is just so powerful, but the more I think about it, the more it seems to add to the game, it makes it interesting. Another think youâll learn quickly is teamwork. You wonât accomplishâ¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥in this game if you donât work together, it just wonât happen. Always have a backup plan too. This game is awesome on many levels and I strongly recommend it to those who like the tactical games. Just keep in mind itâs only tactical if you make that way.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												Throughout the game development, I've loved this game, then hated it.  At this point, I'm loving it.If you are into realism, this is up your alley.  You must aim well and move tactically.  Running & gunning like Call of Duty kids will get you killed very quickly in this game.  Good team work will make a smooth win, and no team work - or bad team work - proves to be a definite failure time after time.I like to think of Insurgency as a slightly arcade version of ARMA.  It's not as technical as ARMA, but it definitely tries to stand on realism.  One or two shots take down enemies, and that's all you can normally take as well.I prefer Co-op (players vs bots) and for now it's pretty good.  The bots do need some work in places, but it's better than it used to be (and better than some other games that utilizes bots).PvP is pretty good too, but due to my lack of experience in that area, I won't comment.There are finally a good amount of custom maps for this game.  No more playing 5-6 maps over and over and over.  There are several game modes for both PvP and Co-Op.  For the price, you can't go wrong.  Even some of the CoD kids might like this.

												I'm slowly putting hours into this game and I have to say it is a gripping game. You don't get a sense of Call of Duty where you are the chosen one that has amazing armor/armour, one shot kills happen, that prevents you from taking real damage. Teamwork is also an essential must in this game. Sure it's nice to have a higher K:D but let us get real for a second...Kills alone can't win an objective, sure it can't hurt and it will help all the time, you have to be conscienous of what you're doing and where your teammates are. I've pulled all nighters playing this game and it just is different everytime. I like the rush I get from an intense firefight that i ran through, an ambush I surived (just barely) the grenade blast that came out of nowhere as I thought I was about to cap an objective. This game gives you a great rush, it has it's quirks to work out but I only have high expectations from here on out. Great product would recommend to anyone that wants the feel of realisim mixed with teamwork and fun.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2014
												  Insurgency is what modern shooters should strive to be like. Setting the standard with extremely difficult but fair gameplay it draws you in by making you actually think about your decisions in game. "Should I lean around this corner?" "If I take this path will there be more enemies?"   The game presents you with tactical decisions that most of the time can and will  decide if you live or die.  The core mechanics of the game rely on teamwork, you have to communicate, you have to be vigilant and watch each other's back. Failure means somebody was not doing their job properly. I've been playing Insurgency since the early beta and I'm extremely happy with forward progress that New World Interactive has had. Despite that however, there are still some things left to be desired. PROS:Extremely tight, precise controls.Good balance of classes and weapons.Variety of games modes to play.Very accurate representation of real world firearms. Fun but challenging gameplay.Great community of modders.CONS:Somewhat hostile PvP and sometimes PvE communties.Bots that can snipe you from half a mile away with AK irons.Random heatseaking RPGs out of nowhere. Alt+Tab sometimes completely crashes the game. Online Servers can be finnicky at times. Hit detection can sometimes fail completely. Suggestions :More general profile stats; Games played, won, lost, accuracy.Improved party system. Better server search function. Reworking the damage and range of shotguns. Most of the time I completely disregard the shotgunbecause of it's tendency either not hit an enemy from 5m away or just not do any damage if I hit them at all.Reworking some maps, I.E. Heights.  Overall, Insurgency is a great game with a huge learning curve. You cannot jump into this game with the intention of running through and mowing down anything in your path. The decisions you make result in how much fun you have with the game. New World Interactive does an extremely good job of updating the AI's pathfinding and combat skills. I feel with every update the games becomes more challenging, and with that more rewarding when you finally beat a map. This is not a game for people who are used to Battlefield or Call of Duty play styles. Once you get past the gigantic learning curve Insurgency becomes a game that you simply cannot put down.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												Insurgency is a limited UI multiplayer only first person shooter that pits insurgents and security forces against each other in armed combat.I am a casual gamer. I am, however, a very passionate casual gamer. Some would say that is an oxymoron, but I disagree. You see, as a casual gamer I value my personal time greatly. When I play a game I don't want to feel restricted or held back by the game. As a consumer of a product I also do not want to feel alienated or swindled by pomp and circumstance of flashy and obnoxious things such as character customization and  inventory micromanagement everytime I get a new item. I also don't want to have to play 40 hours a week to level up and get the items I need to compete with the other "top" players. I want to be able to sit down, log in and shoot people in the face with the same gun, same equipement that everyone else has, and log off with a grin on my face when I'm done. I want my personal experiance and skills to be my only limitations.Insurgency is the game that if counter strike took that next big step it would be. Character graphics are not highly detailed and beautiful as the "AAA" shooters, but as cliche as it sounds, that doesn't matter. The environment that you have to actually look at for more than 2.5 second before you blow it's balls off is gorgeous. I don't like using the term "realism" when refering to military first person shooters, but as such it feels realistic and sounds realistic, it feels gritty and raw. You scream for mercy when you've been hit, you breathe heavy when you run, you can only sprint for a distance that matches the weight you carry. Bullets are precious and even though it's not always one shot one kill, you are likely to die in one to three shots. Hip fire to taunt and make noise, aim to kill - retical and iron sites are  your only real options for a good clean shot. Virutally no UI, no hit markers (just look for the pink mist), no on screen crosshairs, hold your breath on exhale for accuracy - not some weapon addons that turns even the â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥iest firearm into a fully automatic sniper rifle.  There isn't healing, there isn't resupplies; BF and COD fanboys need not apply for this game. You will not get the action packed shooter hero feeling with this, there is no "leveling up", there are no "character customization", there are not achivements. You live and you die by the limited lead that is carried into each battle. I'd like to think the most important thing about insurgency is that team work and the strategies within wins (at least in most game modes). The game is not perfect, devs are constantly tweaking things, so something that worked great for you last month may not work all that well for you now. It can be frustrating, but you make it work. There were severe balance issues with certain maps (S(w)injar), but that has been revamped and is much more balanced now. The second most imporant thing is the community. Dedicated community servers made by people for people to play an awesome game. I have personally purchased and gifted this game to 7 different friends in hopes that they not only would find it as enjoyable as I do, but also to show them what a truly good FPS experiance should be like.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												The best multiplayer First Person Shooter I've ever played. Here's why:-When I play a game that involves guns, I want to feel like I'm shooting an actual gun. This game does just that plain and simple. Long gone are the days of unloading an entire magazine of 30cal rounds into someone only to be knifed in the foot and die. In Insurgency, based on what caliber you're using, and where you hit them, most of the time if the enemy takes 1-2 hits they are going down. Sound design for the weapons impressed me as well - shots sound more like real guns shots when compared to other game's airsoft sounds. One last note about the guns - this game has gotten suppression down really well. It's not a new concept for shooters, but Insurgency does it in a way where you really don't want to poke your head out when hot lead is flying your way.-Teamwork plays a big part in this game. If you are used to being a lonewolf, one-man-army, xx3p1c Kwiksc0p3rxx type of player, you're gonna have a bad time. There is nothing to help you but the people on your team; that's a good problem to have in my opinion. There's no minimap with magical radar, no killstreak bonuses, no floating crosshairs, no BS. Not even an ammo counter. Just you and your team vs the other team. It's simple, intense, and fun.-Every player is equal in this game. Everyone has access to the same weapons depending on which side you're playing on.    -Map design is pretty solid. Nice mix of close quarters, medium and long range.(Bonus: Night maps are great. NVGs, flashlights, flares, the works)Can't recommend this enough if you like a good shooter. You just have to keep in mind this isn't arcade style where you can run around and lunge at someone 3.25 football fields away and knife them. This is a good mix between realism and competitive fast paced action.9/10.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												If your looking for a super realistic FPS you will most likely love this game, there is no crosshair, healthbar, ammo count or minimap, making for a very different experience from your average fps game. However if you get frustrated easily this game may not be for you, as you can get shot and not know where the bullet came from and be dead before you have any clue of whats going on. One of the problems I have had with this game are bad teams (not the games fault) and badly balanced maps, most maps are good but some are really poorly designed where one team will get hammered by the enemy (not due to teams), because the other team just starts off with better positions; but this is true to the real world, war is never fair. Also to get the most out of this game use a mic and comunicate, it makes the game more fun and helps your teamates. It runs on the source engine so you will get good FPS if you are on a low end computer and is supported by multiple operating systems. Graphics are decent but will not compete with bigger franchises like Battlefiled or Call of Duty. For the price (when I bought it on sale it was $4.50) it is extremely good value and I highly recommend it if your are interested in it.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 16, 2014
												"The game that totally made me don't want to get into a firearms fight in real life even though it doesn't show spilled guts and smells of death."Insurgency is a tactical modern infrantry combat simulator. No fancy health regeneration, hit markers, crosshairs or even "enemy killed" pop ups or health bars. All you have is your team, bunch of enemies spred in usually urban environment, objectives to capture and nicely looking and well animated weapon that feels like real one (I've been shooting real AK, M4, a pump action shotgun and a bolt action rifle IRL and I can tell you what feels real).There also is flexible inventory letting you chose equipment and weapon modules, letting you invest on silence of you weapons, heavier armor and weapons or extra explosives used as tactical advantage. It doesn't work the same way as in other  shooters - all your abilities are determined by your chose of equipment, not by silly "perks".You might think that Battlefield multiplayer in hardcore mode can give you more than Insurgency, so what's so special?The realism and the game design. You camp instead of running in the field killing everything that moves, you wait instead of rushing forward the enemies "to get easier kills", you are careful instead of being a rambo, you move out when other guys cover you otherwise you're in bigger risk, you work as a team and you get rewarded if do your best. If you don't, then the life is short. The game in unforgiving - every mistake is a deadly risk, every move gets even more risky as you get closer to your target. It's like chess where you're just one of the figures when all the other figures do their moves at the same time. The tension is always high while both teams are careful and try to find perfect balance between safety and mobility...And then the opposing forces meets, and the skrimish begins and concrete dust raises... The first act may only take a second and few fighters are down, while the others try react and understand the situation so they can and regroup to meet the threat. You only survive long enough if you do as people do on real war: "you hope that other guys get killed instead of you". You only love this game if you play it like if it was a real war... and I say it's immersive not because it looks great, but because it feels great. If it looked as good as it feels, you would get PTSD after a short while. Looking forward for VR edition...

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												Really swell game! Good graphics if you don't look at them too close. Great weapon system. Co-op is good, though the bots can sometimes pull off insane kills with unlikely guns from far away (shotguns, full-auto gunfire, rpgs, ect...). Though the maps are similar, the gameplay is always different and your actions have consequences. Not guarding a flank can kill your whole team.     Several aspects of the game do need improvement though, especially in co-op. There are pretty much two types of bots out there. Those that suck and stand there (even sometimes run out in the open) with their guns pointed in the air. And those who corner camp and/or can headshot you before you can see them, with a shotgun. The bots also need a little tweaking in the molotov department, as they can accurately aim a molotov at you and throw it as high as possible and hit you with it. Also, the armor system is a bit odd. Sometimes you can survive insane amounts of gunfire and think, I should be dead. While other times you can be wearing the heavy armor and die from one pistol shot.     Overall , I would reccommend this game, but caution people too. If you don't like long respawn periods, then DO NOT buy this game. The consequences I mentioned earlier are basically very long times of sitting in your chair spectating another player because you died and there aren't any more reinforcement waves. Even though many people would consider this a con, I consider it a pro because it gives you a better sense of mortality and that you actually need to be aware and careful. I'd give this game a 8.5/10, it truly is my favorite hardcore fps out there. Buy this game while it's on sale!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												Tl;Dr "If you like CS:GO or tactical shooters then this is definitely worth a try."Insurgency is a tactical shooter game made by New World Interactive and is based on the source engine.The game is based on the Half Life 2 mod insurgency and takes lots of inspiration from the Battlefield 2 mod: Project Reality.Gameplay:The gameplay is set around online multiplayer adverserial with gamemodes which revole around capture points, VIP's and intel.Each gamemode has its own playstyle and challanges.Insurgency calls itself a tactical shoot and it really does the genre justice. You usually die in a few hits and cant afford to run and gun, since it will get you killed. In other words not a game for the faint hearthed, because this game will make your hearth raise when the time is ticking and you're the last person on your team to make the difference between winning and losing.The map design is done just right there are no real choke-points and there is always a way of breaking though the enemys defence without making it unfair for either team. Even though they did nail the map balance there are still some nasty bugs with terrain clipping and invisible walls (specifically on the map "Peak"). The loadout system has an interesting balance, it gives you set ammount of points to spend on weapons Counter Strike style, but instead of earing those points, it will give you them upfront. I do really like this system, it makes it so that there wont be inbalance due to firepower and the combinations are practically endless. Gunplay:The gunplay is done really wel in this game, the bullet goes where you aim, but the kick of the weapons make sure it wont be a simple fact of point and click. All the guns come with their own sounds which are really well done and give you a real sense of immersion. Each weapon also has its own animation and every reload will be a joy because of that.Severs and matchmaking:The matchmaker is definitely one of the game its flaws, it works fine when theres is plenty of people online, but when theres not it tends to throw you in to servers with one or two people on it. Luckily there is the sever browser which makes it so you can always find a game you like. Another important note is that sometimes the game does have laggspikes, however not very often, this will is something really annoying when you're trying to line up that perfect shot and it just laggs out at that one crucial point.When you enter the game you will probably also notice in the mainmenu that there is a player tier and rank, however these ranks do not influence the game or matchmaking in anyway (but it does give some nice bragging rights).Verdict:I will definitely recommend this game to anyone who has played first person shooters before, people who want to get in to tactical shooters or someone who is looking for a challenging and competetive game. I'd definitely not recommend this game for anyone looking for something light and/or easy to play. Even though the minor complaints about your casual lagg-spike or a bad hitbox here and there, this game is a definite buy for me and delivers hours (if not days) of fun and replayability.

content:
Posted: December 1, 2014
												It is one of the best games i have played. It is pretty realistic, if you shoot someone you won't get a message (In other games like Call of Duty and Battlefield you will be noticed if you have shot someone). Also, if you hit a enemy 2 or 3 times he will be killed. This is much more realistic than allmost every other game.Especially the COOP mode is awesome, it is nice to play with friends. 1 thing, if the bots are at unforgiving it is allmost impossible to reach the end of the level. Another point i love about the game is the possibility to adjust your weapons. It differences from the weight you can carry how much attachments you can use. If you play in COOP and everyone is killed in your team the weight you can carry will increase by one. This makes it easier to play the level, because you can carry more explosives or more ammo. I can totally recommend the game! I would give the game a 9/10. It is a shooter how it should be, simple to play. You can make it to the end of a level without using tactics, but it is the smartest thing to do if you want to survive as long as possible.

												I've always liked hardcore shooters like battlefield where its super realistic and enivonments are destructible, is what what i would have still been saying if i never played this game. I came scross this game as i was new to steam and wanted to find a legit shooter. And i came across this, saw the images and videos, looked up and read reviews, and i was immediately hooked. I bought the game and of course, i ran in guns blazing like COD or BF, but i immidieatly realized that was the worst possible decsion. One shot one kill now runs through my head when i play this. I love this game. This is all i play now and i cant get enough of how badass this game is. I would highly recomend to any gamer looking for a little challenge or wanting to try something new. Takes a while to get used to how actually not die all the time but when you learn the strategies and tactics, it's a very rewarding experience. This game also HIGHLY requires communications with your teammates or else everything will go horribly wrong.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
												With the execption of the map Peak, this game gets so many things right. The brutally immersive gameplay is unparalleled in the way that it balances realism and controls. Unlike a certain game, you won't find yourself having to learn a bunch of controls to do simple actions. One of my favorite things about this game is its accessibility. Although you probably won't start out super good, if you learn from how you died the last 25 times you'll improve. If you put in enough time, you'll stop treating most FPS as "run-and-gun" games. This game forces you to be tactical and thorough with the penalty being death.  The most noticable disadvatage new players have is map awareness.I'm constantly surprised by the AI in Insurgency's Co-op modes. The AI are neither easy nor predictable and I guarantee you'll be surprised by how challenging they can be. They won't just gun you down if you're standing directly in front of an AI bots; they will flank you, surpress you, snipe you, toss smokes at you, and even incendiaries/molotovs. Beating the AI actually requires a level of teamwork that makes lone-wolfing it rather difficult. On "forgiving" or easy, you can easily cut through bots with a team that communicates so once you beat the maps, change it to "unforgiving"/medium or "brutal"/hard. I'm always suprised by how many times I can play a round of Checkpoint on the same map and have it play differently (except Ministry... it's pretty linear on Chekpoint).I could go on and on about the various PvP modes... To keep it short, there's a mode for everyone.This game is a value buy. Even though it is only priced at $14.99 USD, it usually goes on sale on Steam for something like $7 and sometimes cheaper on Humble Bundle. and... that's it. You won't find yourself purchasing a bunch of DLC packs. New World Interactive (the developers) release new content in free updates. That's not to say that the game never changes though. Not only are there a lot of brilliant works on the Steam Workshop, there are also servers that run custom maps too. Although I originally thought that the New World Interactive cheaped out on this game- I've come to learn how the simplicity of Insurgency is quite fitting. In a realistic way, it doesn't give you an abundance of information. The HUD is very minimalist and clean. However, there are many details which make the game visually appealing as well. This includes smoke trails from your gun, really intense surpression, and tracer rounds that give away the position of the shooter.Did I mention there are no kill indicators (with the exception of a few servers)? Have fun checking corpses to confirm your own kills!!!...and running/sprinting only brings you closer to the gates of hell. You will be gunned down without mercy- True Story.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2015
												I just want to say a few words about the truly amazing policy of NWII haven't seen a game in a long time that lives up to the immense support insurgency gets from its developers. Not only do they update the content (maps, weapons, gadgets, gamemodes... you name it) and gameplay frequently, they also don't cash any money for their DLCs. While we live in times where companies charge money for DLCs that come out at the release day of their games, NWI really shows how it should be done. This game is an example of true customer service that stands out in a world of greedy game companies.love it.(PS. I would not say this the most realistic game. As fun as it is and most people that play this game ofton will agree with me, its a spray and pray. You get shot a few times and for the most part you die but if they are wearing heavy armor it could take up to nine shots to take him down. Everyones gun is pretty much always on full auto when in he military it is almost always on semi automatic. If it is on full auto its in short controlled burst and in insurgency its let me spray the ground the walls the bushes and anywhere near you Iand hope they died and go onto the next obj. But the game is amazing besides the few cons I mentioned. Gr8 game  IR8/8)

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												Insurgency is one of the most precious First Person Shooters we have today, its a Realistic and Tactical game, wich needs team cooperation to win the match.Its a very intense game, it makes you go crazy while your killing, and make you fear when under fire.So Welcome to Insurgency, a TRUE FPS, with , no Hit Marks, no MAP, no HP, no MEDIC'S, no HELP and not ridiculous Killstreaks, its a true firefight Bad guys vs Good guys.The game counts with a Squad system wich both teams have 2 Squads, each squad have a number of classes that you will use in battle, nothing changes class to class but some classes have Guns that others not, such as Sniper and Support, also the game has Very good maps and map voting system, and one of the maps are from the Mod : Insurgency Modern Combat, wich is great too.It has 8 types of Game Modes like Push, Skirmish, Strike, Co-op or even Search And Destroy. all of then extremely balanced for both teams.Guns in this game have a incredible realistic damage, so you kill with 1 bullet using a pistol, but you also die with 1 bullet, so do not run arround the map, stay with your team and try to complet the objectives.The Graphics and Sounds are great, i'm really impressed what source engine can do with big jobs, that game has a lot of details, and a lot of Post-processing effects.If you guys enjoy this game such as me, try to play the MOD, Insurgeny: Modern Combat, its great, and show how much work this guys did to make such good game like this, years of work made a exepcional game.So, i'm going to tell you that if you are a Battlefield or Call of duty player, please don't run, try to learn how to play this game, you will be a better player in the future, i promise, but first you going to play Insurgency, and die a lot....A lot.But also Red Orchestra or Arma players are going to be good in this game, they have pacience to play it. so Just 15$ for that kind of good game? what the hell are you waiting for? buy it...Now!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												For new players who haven't played shooters in a while, or at all, This game is a (fun) never-ending panic attack until you figure out what you're meant to be doing. For those coming here from Counter Strike, you'll be frustrated to realise yolu won't be able to survive 12 hits. 2, at most. Don't even expect to be extremely useful with a bolt-action rifle (like the AWP), as Insurgency is based more towards fast paced close quarters combat. You often find yourself right up in your enemy's face, shooting from point blank and hoping he doesn't fire first. Just remember that YOU HAVE TO CAP POINTS TO RESPAWN YOUR TEAM unless it's a game mode with "Waves" of reinforcements. But even then, once you run out of "Waves" you WILL HAVE TO CAPTURE A POINT OR OBJECTIVE TO RESPAWN YOUR TEAM. Pros:-Fun-Fast paced-Realistic damage. 1-2 hits usualy does the job.-Proper accuracy. None of this ******** expanding reticule stuff. Firing from the hip will screw your acuracy. Aiming does make it easier.-Gun/kit modification. As long as you have supply points, you can change your loadout and primary mods.Cons:-WHAT AM I DOING?! Little bit panicky at the start. Though I like that, others may not.-No railguns. Railguns make everything better. <3

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												Such a satisfying game to play. Rushing into an objective or successfully flanking an enemy is one of the most fun things I've done in any gaming experience. Hearing sniper shots fly over your head or friendly/enemy bodies falling into the ditch you're crawling through makes you feel like a real soldier, which makes getting kills that much more badass. Gunplay is probably the best thing about this game, being that it is on source engine. Guns are heavy, feel real, have good recoil, and work like they should. Most guns sound very similar to how they sound in real life, and enemies die in 1-2 shots from almost every gun aside from sidearms. Depending on if you want to use the workshop, you can get different player/gun skins, different blood textures, etc. Such a fun game to play with friends as well, to talk tactically and push up. The VOIP system in game leaves something to be desired, as it doesn't fully capture the quality of your microphone, so I reccomend playing with friends and using something like teamspeak. A game fully worth the cheap price, buy it today and become that badass soldier you always wanted to be.

content:
Posted: February 7, 2014
												After playing the game alot in the past days, I can tell it's really good.In my opinion, this game is a combination of Red orchestra, Call of duty and Counterstrike.Playing smart leads to satisfying victories and it never gets old.The map design is fun and well made.The game isn't perfect, but the devs are regularely patching the game.Amongst things I hope they improve, customization of a few weapons seems to be overlooked. Most assault rifles and weapons have alot of attachments and modifications available, which makes you able to make your own kit and personnalize it towards your role and your gameplay. However, The sniper rifle only has a single mod available, AP ammo. yep. That sucks. Not that Ap ammo is bad, but it just doesn't feel like it actually changes anything. Why didn't they add options like the red dot like every other weapon in the game has, or the laser sights. or the silencer. you get the drill.the game seems and feels balanced overall, but there are some things I can't get my head around as to why they even did this. An example is that in order for a Insurgent to get light armor, he needs 2 supplies(currency used to make your weapon kit, you have 10 by default). If he wants a heavy armor, he needs 4 supplies. Seems good, however, Security forces can get the light armor for free and the heavy armor for 2 supplies, while the insurgents dont seem to get any advantage besides the fact that their special ammo types( AP and HP) cost 1 less supply. These are only minor flaws and can be changed in a flash, So it's no big deal for now.TL:DR Fun game, give the devs some breathing room,Balanced gameplay with weird elements. 8/10.

content:
Posted: November 13, 2014
												I would compare Insurgency to ARMA mixed with Counter-Strike on Battlefield maps.I don't know if that's accurate... There is no HUD, no HP bar. There is no mini-map, and there is no real tutorial.This is a tactical shooter that is honestly very reminiscent of CoD3 for me, and that's a good thing. I remember CoD3 had maps with clutch points and large-scale teamplay. You set down a machine gun and give supressing fire while your snipers can get into position, you throw a smoke to let your teammates cross the bridge safely; it's not just run n' gun nonsense of the CoD4+ generation. You'll have moments where you're playing the frontman and you have to dive from cover to cover to push into the enemy, or while you search distant buildings with your M40A1 for enemy sniper positions. These are very satisfying and well-done within the game.There are bugs, more so than I'd like, but they nevertheless come up pretty rarely.Going to give this an 8/10, definitely worth a buy if you're into the genre.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I bought this game for $8.99, having loved Arma 3 i figured what the hell, I can use another Precision, team based, hardcore FPS. everything about this game i love, great controls, feels smooth when aiming, and the levels i think are some of the best around. playing as an insurgent with AK platform weapons and even old surplus military weapons like the mosin-nagant, mp40, even an sks and a ruger mini-14 to a m1a1 paratrooper model! whats great is the attachments can go on all the guns, just a matter of how bulky your gun is (attachments go by weight so a big M1 marksman rifle can hold 1 or 2 slots, whereas a tiny UMP45 or mp40 can hold 4 to 5) the gun physics are amazing, better than arma 3 in my opinion. you honestly feel like your in a shootout and can feel your shoulder weaken after letting off a clip into a brick wall suppressing enemies behind it. the recoil is so accurate, yet not so difficult to where a full auto isnt effective. yes, you dont want to hold down the trigger, but short burst tend to be on point most of the time. i like how theres no leveling system, everybody is equal, you just choose your guns by the squad you join (machine gunner, recon, scout, rifleman, demolition,sapper, militant,engineer) so it forces you to work as a team as a whole, and wont put you up againt a team of "quickscopers" or LMG guys.bottom line, if youre thinking about getting this game, DO IT. it is so much fun you will highly enjoy it. if you liked any other military simulators (but hated how buggy and glitchy Arma 3 is) than this is your next game. the price itself should be enough to buy it, cause i wouldve bought it for $15 if i had known about it before the summer sale. you really cant go wrong with the game OR the price. I (and you) will be playing this game well into next years Steam Summer Sale.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												For new players who haven't played shooters in a while, or at all, This game is a (fun) never-ending panic attack until you figure out what you're meant to be doing. For those coming here from Counter Strike, you'll be frustrated to realise yolu won't be able to survive 12 hits. 2, at most. Don't even expect to be extremely useful with a bolt-action rifle (like the AWP), as Insurgency is based more towards fast paced close quarters combat. You often find yourself right up in your enemy's face, shooting from point blank and hoping he doesn't fire first. Just remember that YOU HAVE TO CAP POINTS TO RESPAWN YOUR TEAM unless it's a game mode with "Waves" of reinforcements. But even then, once you run out of "Waves" you WILL HAVE TO CAPTURE A POINT OR OBJECTIVE TO RESPAWN YOUR TEAM. Pros:-Fun-Fast paced-Realistic damage. 1-2 hits usualy does the job.-Proper accuracy. None of this ******** expanding reticule stuff. Firing from the hip will screw your acuracy. Aiming does make it easier.-Gun/kit modification. As long as you have supply points, you can change your loadout and primary mods.Cons:-WHAT AM I DOING?! Little bit panicky at the start. Though I like that, others may not.-No railguns. Railguns make everything better. <3

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												Such a satisfying game to play. Rushing into an objective or successfully flanking an enemy is one of the most fun things I've done in any gaming experience. Hearing sniper shots fly over your head or friendly/enemy bodies falling into the ditch you're crawling through makes you feel like a real soldier, which makes getting kills that much more badass. Gunplay is probably the best thing about this game, being that it is on source engine. Guns are heavy, feel real, have good recoil, and work like they should. Most guns sound very similar to how they sound in real life, and enemies die in 1-2 shots from almost every gun aside from sidearms. Depending on if you want to use the workshop, you can get different player/gun skins, different blood textures, etc. Such a fun game to play with friends as well, to talk tactically and push up. The VOIP system in game leaves something to be desired, as it doesn't fully capture the quality of your microphone, so I reccomend playing with friends and using something like teamspeak. A game fully worth the cheap price, buy it today and become that badass soldier you always wanted to be.

content:
Posted: November 13, 2014
												Insurgency is possibly the best realistic game I have ever played, It's hard to believe I was just judging it at first till I experienced it my self, This isn't your average FPS game this is a new type of FPS game taken to a new level, where there is no advantages, It's just pure skill and luck based, where you can either communicate with your team to ensure your great success in winning or just play for fun and just solo it out by your self, either way soon as you jump into the battlefield and learnt all the controls you'll soon deeply love how the game plays not to mention how beautiful it looks as well as a Workshop to touch it off for more customizable features to the game, as well as game modes to choose from, customizable weaponry, night scenes/maps and so many more, for more information about the game I highly suggest checking out their main website.Pros:Realism Graphics and Game play.No Hud, Ammo Counter, Tagging System (Besides Team-Mates) or anything, It's completely just who's your team mate where are the objectives that's it.Classes/Roles to choose from which best suits you.Customizable weapons.Tons of missions and scenes/maps to choose from.First Person Perspective while holding the weapon is fantastic I dunno how you couldn't enjoy it, It's hard to explain.Only get one life till an objective is either captured or destroyed which make It more pressurable for both teams to make you really think about your actions.Cons:Land Mesh is some times buggy or in certain areas.Smoke Grenades are some what unrealistic and can cause clipping issues (For example, smoke clipping through walls, roofs and objects)Jumping over object's or in general isn't too fancy.I'd give this game a soild - 9/10

content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												Although Insurgency isn't the most realistic shooter as of yet, it certainly shines by combining elements of realistic, unforgiving, and hardcore gameplay. Zero health regeneration, quick deaths, and the fact that your opponent could be just around the corner make for very exciting gameplay that keeps players on edge, fingers ready on their left mouse button. Matches are usually fast and furious, adding to the tension and excitement. In addition, an assortment of gamemodes and maps exist for those players who like variety. Players can take on other players head-on in a Firefight match or attempt to survive against AI-controlled enemies in nighttime environments while playing Survival. Also, the community is rather friendly and they churn out marvelous stuff that is available in the Steam Workshop. Yes, I forgot to mention that Insurgency does possess Workshop support. These workshop items offer numerous customizations and could make playing Insurgency even more fun. The developers, New World Interactive, are also very active, often looking for opinions from the community on how to improve the game and releasing frequent patches and updates. However, as is the case with every game, Insurgency does have its weak points. It can be quite buggy at certain times and the community is rather small at the moment. Nevertheless, these are not major flaws and are vastly overshadowed by the pros of playing this game. For a relatively low price, Insurgency offers a very in-depth experience comparable to that of bigger and more showy titles like Battlefield or Call of Duty. This game is a must-buy for all FPS fans. Rating: 5 stars. Not just any kind of stars. GOLDEN STARS.

												A solid and fun game, especially since it's free to play after the initial purchase. As of this review, the developers just released Nightfall, a free expansion. The game seems to be on the right development track and has a proven record since it was once a mod.In terms of mechanics: the game is fluid and has a high number of both servers and players. There is a wide selections of weapons and the ability to chose what stuff you put on them is also a nice touch. I recommend this game for those who enjoy medium-paced squad based action. Remember to work in a team and coordinate with your fellow players.ProTips:- Get a microphone- Remember to lean around corners (default keys are Q and E)- Don't sprint everywhere you'll get run over- Throw grenades a little higher than you think they should go, they fall low

content:
Posted: June 15, 2014
												Amazing game, to put it in more simple terms!The way you get gunned down mercilessly by one bullet by making one bad move is crazy. Walking into a room, shooting a guy running past the window... And not expecting the realistic sounds as your gun makes a massive sound. Then realizing that you just alerted everyone in the surrounding street block that you are there. Walking through the back door into the alley, seeing movement and not knowing if it is friendly or hostile, then hearing a bang and your screen tilts sideways and goes black slowly as your first person view jerks toward the ground, possibly glimpsing the sniper move from the 2nd story window in the second before your screen is fully black.This game is a master piece. As I tell all my friends who haven't heard of it, it's like Battlefield... Ramped up about 5 levels. No HUD, ammo count, or even names above everyone on the field. To top it off, it is always a mystery whether or not you actually killed that guy you were shooting at.I can not put justice to this game in words. A must play game for any serious or even casual FPS player. For you COD players, this game throws even more dirt on COD than Battlefield does.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												Before I start this review I have to say that this is an extremely hardcore game so if you are a Call Of Duty fanboy, leave right now.First let's start with the pros:Awesome shooting mechanic, even though there is no hit marker you can still tell that you have shot somebody, because they either scream like a maniac or leave a massive blood puddle behind them.The scopes and sights feel amazing. Unlike most other FPS games, when you zoom with a scope, the scope zooms in but the area around you does not, and it feels really nice, a couple of games have done this like Red Orchestra 2/Rising Storm and the absolute travesty Call Of Duty Ghosts.In Insurgency you cannot run and gun, instead you have to communicate with your teammates and use cover to your advanntage.Conclusion:It feels like a modern Red Orchestra mixed with Counter Strike, I'll let you make your mind on if you want to get Insurgency or not.And now a few of the cons:Sometimes you will feel cheated when you die either because someone is camping a choke point or you got one shotted by an MP5k.For a source game it is quite resource intensive so if you have a slow computer expect to run this on lower settings

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												9.5/10Intense and terrifying when under fire, a (noob-)friendly community that is used to getting killed for the slightest mistake, which is essentially part of the experience. Is it the most realistic shooter out there? Definitely not. There is no wound system like in some other games, usually you get shot and you die. In all honesty, many of the characteristics that would make it more realism-oriented (a complete lack of respawns, wound system, no HUD, ...) would in no doubt hurt the gameplay, which is now excellent. It certainly feels like a real firefight and the coop is as unforgiving as the player-v-player. The gameplay is tweaked in such a way that teamwork is not just key, but also a necessity to survival. This makes it important to communicate with other players, which obviously makes it a lot of fun.If youre sick of bunnyhopping-shooters where you can go full Rambo without repercussions or if you have grown insensitive about being under fire (it's not easy shooting back in this game if you're being shot at) then this is the game for you. This is not a sell-out big company game. They do a lot of effort to keep the price low, reward it!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												This is perhaps the greatest FPS I have ever played. It is not the best graphically, but it is the one that pays the most attention to detail. Little things, like not having a crosshair, only knowing how many mags, rather than bullets, you have, really make this game an unforgettable realistic experience. This may be the closest you'll ever want to get to real combat through a screen. The atmosphere is palpable, and at times you will even fear for your life.The maps offer sufficient variety and the updates are near-constant, with new maps being added all the time and old ones refined for better, more intense play. And the setups of each game will force you to cooperate with your teammates to achieve victory.If you like shooters, get this one. I cannot stress that enough.

content:
Posted: August 16, 2014
												Insurgency... the perfect  game I've always been looking for. I am a hardcore realism guy, of course Arma series will always be the best, however this does a hell of a job without all the clunky controls arma has, of course sacrificing the giant maps and helis and such. But fk all that, baby. Let me tell you something, this game will run on my old GPU from 2008, and it looks great. But about gameplay... I tried CS:GO... its a arcade experience, uninstalled within 10 minutes. Insurgency does way better for me. REALISM -Bullet Penetration MechanicsQ and E lean mechanicsProne MechanicsNo medic revives/healingSuper high damage, even pistols can kill within 1-3 shots.Headshots always kill no matter what.No croshairsNo minimapOptional friendly fire mechanicNo damage indicatorsSuppression systemNo kill camsThe class system is also very good, there is machine gunners, militants, specialist... riflemen... bombers, sappers. All kind of crazyâ¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥ Each getting its own availible weaponery, C4, AK47u, M4s, or even RPGs. So basicly, the insurgent teams have complete different weapons than the other side, which it seems to be in higher damage, very similar to many real life situations in iraq, Ak47s from terrorist overpower american weapons, however american weapons have more accuracy. It seems very much like that in this game. I'm a guy whos sick of arcade shooters like counter strike and call of duty, and others out there. While it may not have all the crazy combat the battlefield series has... it has more realism than battlefield. In terms of infantry combat. If you want a huge step up from counter strike... lets go bby. See you on the front lines. FK BBY GIVE IT A 10/10 FK FK
