content:
Posted: November 3, 2014
												This game is perfect for hardcore tactical shooter fans who don't want to or can't spend hours on ARMA. The sound design is superb and the feel of the weapons is fantastic. The overall atmosphere feels awesome and the one- or two-shot kills make the gameplay very tactical and methodical.I just wish there were more mechanics in place to encourage teamwork. While a lot of players in Insurgency are very cooperative, I feel this is only because they are the kind of players to be naturally attracted to that play style and not because the game directly encourages them to do so.I'd definitely recommend picking this game up if you enjoy any of the ARMA or Battlefield games, as this fits very well in the middle.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 13, 2014
												Insurgency is possibly the best realistic game I have ever played, It's hard to believe I was just judging it at first till I experienced it my self, This isn't your average FPS game this is a new type of FPS game taken to a new level, where there is no advantages, It's just pure skill and luck based, where you can either communicate with your team to ensure your great success in winning or just play for fun and just solo it out by your self, either way soon as you jump into the battlefield and learnt all the controls you'll soon deeply love how the game plays not to mention how beautiful it looks as well as a Workshop to touch it off for more customizable features to the game, as well as game modes to choose from, customizable weaponry, night scenes/maps and so many more, for more information about the game I highly suggest checking out their main website.Pros:Realism Graphics and Game play.No Hud, Ammo Counter, Tagging System (Besides Team-Mates) or anything, It's completely just who's your team mate where are the objectives that's it.Classes/Roles to choose from which best suits you.Customizable weapons.Tons of missions and scenes/maps to choose from.First Person Perspective while holding the weapon is fantastic I dunno how you couldn't enjoy it, It's hard to explain.Only get one life till an objective is either captured or destroyed which make It more pressurable for both teams to make you really think about your actions.Cons:Land Mesh is some times buggy or in certain areas.Smoke Grenades are some what unrealistic and can cause clipping issues (For example, smoke clipping through walls, roofs and objects)Jumping over object's or in general isn't too fancy.I'd give this game a soild - 9/10

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 3, 2014
												My experience with Insurgency has been an overall pleasing and fun experience.  From the close-quarters streets of Iraq to the mountains of Afghanistan, Insurgency delivers fun.  This game has been one of the few team oriented games that actually rewards teamwork.  It is essential to survival.  The maps are varied and interesting, the weapons are as well, with customization for different playstyles, and the game is overall very impressive for the source engine.  The few bad experiences were: A Hackers and B the map "Peak" on Cooperative vs AI.  The enemy uses RPGs like crazy and it requires a very careful and experienced team to win.  While not impossible, it is tough.  Overall, I rate the game a 9/10

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 15, 2014
												Amazing game, to put it in more simple terms!The way you get gunned down mercilessly by one bullet by making one bad move is crazy. Walking into a room, shooting a guy running past the window... And not expecting the realistic sounds as your gun makes a massive sound. Then realizing that you just alerted everyone in the surrounding street block that you are there. Walking through the back door into the alley, seeing movement and not knowing if it is friendly or hostile, then hearing a bang and your screen tilts sideways and goes black slowly as your first person view jerks toward the ground, possibly glimpsing the sniper move from the 2nd story window in the second before your screen is fully black.This game is a master piece. As I tell all my friends who haven't heard of it, it's like Battlefield... Ramped up about 5 levels. No HUD, ammo count, or even names above everyone on the field. To top it off, it is always a mystery whether or not you actually killed that guy you were shooting at.I can not put justice to this game in words. A must play game for any serious or even casual FPS player. For you COD players, this game throws even more dirt on COD than Battlefield does.

content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												Thought u were THE PLAYER in BF/COD.NOW be prepared to DIE. ALOT. LONE WOLF PWNER? YEAH try that then sit for 15 minutes and watch your mates die. AWESOME. This games brings back teamwork in a way that BF has lost, and COD never had. (yes ive been a LONG time player of both).  It's serious, slightly fun and at times, hard work. One shot to die. Long time to sit it out. Pressure on you when you get the 'last man standing' warning, as you have the chance to respawn the whole team. CHeck the corners, reload asap, look behind. This game is *&^&%&@!! hard, and TBH most of us playing it love it. Sure, the graphics are 2005, the animations are 2001 but the weapon sounds, the balance, the teamwork is what we all wanted in the AAA titles. I for one dont want 16 different grips, 45 different weapons, 55 different camo's etc. OVERIT. â¥â¥â¥â¥ that give us a simple choice, keep it balanced and let skill decide the game YEAH? I died alot in the beginning, but with time and a good squad or two, oh the joy. As a long time advocate of BFBC2, this game reminds what devs can do to bring back simpilicity, TEAMWORK and awesome fun times all at once. BEWARE no killcam, no HUD, no MAG COUNT. Awesome again. Its hard and its challenging BUT that kill, that POINT CAP, can be soooo >>>REWARDING<<< because, you actually earnt it.This game is a good balance between ARMA, BF. CS and RO. Can't recommend highly enough for those in the FPS community who are looking for an extra challenge. You'll mostly find a good community of players who understand Friendly Fire, Teamwork and VoiceChat as you'll need all to succeed :PEnjoy

content:
Posted: September 7, 2014
												As an avid fan of the original Insurgency mod, i can say without a doubt that not much has changed in terms of gameplay. Sure its more refined and comes with quite alot more options tactically and in terms of customization, aswell as a ton of new game-modes. But the game itself remains true to the mod. The maps are mainly recreations of the mod's maps, with the whole CS:GO treatment, meaning more appealing aesthetics and some minor changes. I would recommend this, its kind of hard to get into if you go in with the mentality of most other mainstream shooters, but not as hard as getting into ARMA. Now this is realism, but not to the ARMA degree, its fast-paced and most games do not last that long. The Co-Op is kinda meh, could be alot better.

content:
Posted: October 2, 2014
												Insurgency is a realistic first person shooter that features the realism of modern combat such as carry weight, no HUD (of course) and pretty much 2-5 shots and you're dead. It is a very difficult game to start off with but as you adjust to the multiple gamemodes and maps you will learn the ways of the modern soldier. It features many modern guns such as the M4A4 and the UMP. At times the combat is close quarters and at times long range, but no matter what the distance, the intensity never leaves the game. The in-game voice allows you to communicate and work together with your fellow teammates and lead them to victory.TL:DRYou can spray with a LMG and get 50 kills. 8.6/10.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												So I finally got the chance to try this game out, having thought about buying it for some time now (thanks Humble Bundle!). I figured it was pretty much going to be Counter-Strike on steroids, and just something new for me to master.After getting myâ¥â¥â¥â¥â¥kicked for about two days straight now, I think it's safe to say that there's a bit more to it than that. My assessment of it being CS on steroids was pretty spot on. It shares many of the gameplay mechanics and element with CS, and the general feel of it all is pretty familiar. Just how much steroids it's done, however, is where I stumbled. With over a decade of CS experience, coupled with varying levels of experience with various other FPS-games, I generally dominate all FPS-games I play. Insurgency, though, serves myâ¥â¥â¥â¥â¥for breakfast, and you know what, I'm loving it. Some of that experience does carry over, but if you're thinking about playing this like you would CS, think again. It was the first and most painful lesson I had to learn.Not many bad things to say about this one. About as forgiving as anal cancer, but also just about as satisfying to beat, definitely give this one a spin. Probably going to feel like you're just slamming your face to a brick wall at first, but much more rewarding once you start getting the hang of it than something easy and simple like Call of Duty/Farmville/other kiddy games.

content:
Posted: November 11, 2014
												TL;DR Decent game, worth a tryActually surprisingly fun. Of course I did pick it up for free (Humble Bundle gift) which may have affected that enjoyment but in all seriousness, it's nice to look at and isn't awful. Each mission starts of with you choosing a role (Which affects the equipment and weapons you can choose from). From this you then get a certain amount of points to spend on attactments for your weapons, armour you can pick from or grenades. In this fashion it's similar to the point systems you can find in later CoD games without the perks. As the mission progresses you will get more points you can spend on outfitting your character.You do have regenerating health but you yourself cannot really take much punishment from enemy fire. In this regards it's similar to ARMA. It does have a fatigue system (Which honestly, didn't seem that apparent. Only have really noticed it in the training mission). Also enemies did seem to die in one hit most of the time, even on the harder AI settings. The AI, however, do seem to be incredibly accurate and will ruin you if you let them. Didn't really try much of the PvP. From what I did try of it I died over and over, getting a few kills here and there. That's more indictive of my playstyle and mind set rather then the game itself though. If you had a group of friends you could probably enjoy the co-op modes quite a bitAs far as my gripes with it there isn't really much indication of taking damage apart from the screen blurring around the edges (Which happens if you take damage or if the bullets fly past you) and a sound clip (Which seems to play in the same circumstances). Also focusing your fire (Which scopes in a bit more and muffles most of the sound) is the same key as sprinting. Most of the time I found myself sprinting in a direction rather then getting this extra zoom level. Moving slightly will also take you out of this focus.Overall it's worth a shot. Sure to get a few hours of enjoyment out of it at least. Recommend picking up in a sale.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2014
 Insurgency    Field Rating Review   Graphics 7 I will admit that Insurgency is not anything visually amazing, But the detail put into the guns and the realism is extremely well done.   Gameplay 10 The game has no hud,no ammo count,no name tags on enemies! It takes tactical teamplay to the next level, With realistic guns and weapon handling! It can make some intense firefights.   Multiplayer 10 The mixture of new gameplay styles (you can't just run and gun here, you'll die), tactics, realism and some funny glitches make this a very fun game! Its worth giving it a try! I have met some funny and really friendly players that made the game more enjoyable.   Overall 8 Lets be honest here, I didn't expect to have such a fun time with Insurgency, but it is easily the most fun I have with my friends on a FPS in a longtime. If you're playing this one alone, it's good. But when you're playing it with friends, it is absolutely grand. A refreshing game in a field of run-and-gun FPS games, a free game at that. number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 13, 2014
												I just got this game in the latest Humble Bundle and have 16 hours on so far. Wait, 16? I'm not sure that's right. A good two nights worth of play so I don't think I'm up to 16. That must count afk time. Anyway.... It's a fun game! It's objective team based 'realistic' shooter with a terrorist/ counterterrorist theme. It features PvP and PvE maps based on which server you join. It's not a run and gun type of game. Running actually feels pretty slow and walking is even slower. There is a little run+slide thing for getting to cover and you can go prone so there's a little more depth than just walking and shooting. No crosshairs except for iron sights or mods that you put on your gun. Being 1 life to live, a couple twitch players (or cheaters, I don't know) can really turn a battle. Of course if you manage to kill that guy, it really hurts the team too. Built in VOIP is good quality but of course you also have to deal with trolls. Tip: To kick someone, hit ESC and Call Vote.PvE experience can vary depending on your tolerance for aimbots. You are playing against bots so without good scripting the only way to vary difficulty is to change the speed of their aimbot. On Brutual, it's not uncommon to insta-die before you see the bot because he shoots you through the corner of a wall that you can barely see his foot past. PvE modes vary too. Most commonly you'll play checkpoint which is like progressing through an assault map in Battlefield. You push up to an objective, capture it, and then progress down the map to the next objective, continuing to do so until you win or die. 1 life to live until someone captures an objective and all players are revived. The most annoying mode is Survival where you run around from objective to objective, usually with just a pistol and knife, trying to avoid getting killed by bots. If bots are on Brutal, one of these maps will clear out the server if there isn't an admin to change it. lol...PvP is good. Maps can be like capture the flag or assault-type maps like from Battlefield. Teams usually have 'waves' which is respawns as opposed to a ticker per life. Depending on the map, waves can be gained by capturing objectives allowing for some very fun and intense matches when your team is hanging onto that last wave, trading an objective back and forth with the opposing team. Weapons seem relatively balanced but I always do better w/ Security (CT) weapons than Insurgents (T). The game could do with a few ease of life updates like saving preferred builds but overall it's a very good game. I don't know how much it normally goes for but that 4 pack bundle for $45 making it about $11/ea doesn't sound that bad. Of course I got the 4 pack as part of a $12 humble bundle with Saints Row IV included so I definitely think it's worth it!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2014
												Let's start off with something, this game is amazing.When you first start off in the game your going to be put in a Battlefeild/Counter strike enviroment, choosing between two teams (Insurgency or Security), you will be faced with a detailed loadout selection and class selection. Each class on each team has access to different guns, attachments etc. And you have a set amount of equipment tokens/points to spend on your loadout. You also have a weight meter which can determine whether your loadout will make you run fast or slow, and how fast your stamina will run out.Now lets get into the combat:The combat is fast paced at times and slow paced at others, you will constantly find yourself having to visually inspect whether you have killed a person and wondering "should i check or should i run past and hope the enemy is dead". From the last sentence you probably can tell the game is going to be realistic. It is. If you move up on your own your playing a wild card, instead you might want to call out a couple of your teammates to help you complete/capture an objective (Yes, there are a lot of different gamemodes to choose from, most of which include control areas). There is virtually no HUD (Heads Up Display), the only things that do show up on the hud is how many magazines you have, and info about the objective(s). The gunplay is realistic, recoil is a thing and attachments can supress that recoil but also you can by swithing modes on your gun or burst firing. 1-2 bullets from most guns can take down an enemy.Lets talk graphics:The graphics in the game are not spectactular, but still enough to immerse you in the gameplay, though the design and textures on the weapons look great. You can't really expect a game run and made on the source engine  and is only slightly modified is going to get you amazing Battlefield graphics.Overall Gameplay:The gameplay is realistic, tense and rewarding if you play the game right, what a mordern military shooter should be, it offers great and realistic gunplay, a variety of gamemodes and maps. Insurgency will keep you coming back to play some more (also teamwork is a thing in this game).

I give this a 9/10 because the gameplay is really enjoyable but it doesn't get a 10 because there are still some bugs and lagg problems that need to be fixed.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 13, 2014
												I just got this game in the latest Humble Bundle and have 16 hours on so far. Wait, 16? I'm not sure that's right. A good two nights worth of play so I don't think I'm up to 16. That must count afk time. Anyway.... It's a fun game! It's objective team based 'realistic' shooter with a terrorist/ counterterrorist theme. It features PvP and PvE maps based on which server you join. It's not a run and gun type of game. Running actually feels pretty slow and walking is even slower. There is a little run+slide thing for getting to cover and you can go prone so there's a little more depth than just walking and shooting. No crosshairs except for iron sights or mods that you put on your gun. Being 1 life to live, a couple twitch players (or cheaters, I don't know) can really turn a battle. Of course if you manage to kill that guy, it really hurts the team too. Built in VOIP is good quality but of course you also have to deal with trolls. Tip: To kick someone, hit ESC and Call Vote.PvE experience can vary depending on your tolerance for aimbots. You are playing against bots so without good scripting the only way to vary difficulty is to change the speed of their aimbot. On Brutual, it's not uncommon to insta-die before you see the bot because he shoots you through the corner of a wall that you can barely see his foot past. PvE modes vary too. Most commonly you'll play checkpoint which is like progressing through an assault map in Battlefield. You push up to an objective, capture it, and then progress down the map to the next objective, continuing to do so until you win or die. 1 life to live until someone captures an objective and all players are revived. The most annoying mode is Survival where you run around from objective to objective, usually with just a pistol and knife, trying to avoid getting killed by bots. If bots are on Brutal, one of these maps will clear out the server if there isn't an admin to change it. lol...PvP is good. Maps can be like capture the flag or assault-type maps like from Battlefield. Teams usually have 'waves' which is respawns as opposed to a ticker per life. Depending on the map, waves can be gained by capturing objectives allowing for some very fun and intense matches when your team is hanging onto that last wave, trading an objective back and forth with the opposing team. Weapons seem relatively balanced but I always do better w/ Security (CT) weapons than Insurgents (T). The game could do with a few ease of life updates like saving preferred builds but overall it's a very good game. I don't know how much it normally goes for but that 4 pack bundle for $45 making it about $11/ea doesn't sound that bad. Of course I got the 4 pack as part of a $12 humble bundle with Saints Row IV included so I definitely think it's worth it!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												I can only speak for the Co-Op (PvE) game play as I have yet to try Multiplayer (PvP). It's been a lot of fun playing Insurgency Co-Op. I wasn't sure what to think of it going in as it's not exactly the newest game out there, but I'm glad I decided to give it a try. The community has been very friendly and helpful. There are five different game modes in Co-Op to suit different tastes and play styles. A lot of different maps to play on, many with nighttime versions (bring on the night vision!). Not to mention a whole lot more great custom maps made by the community. This game lends itself well to playing cooperatively with other players and it's a ton of fun to work towards the same goals together. There isn't any character progression meaning weapons to unlock or skills. Just whatever load out you choose from a list of classes and weapons. From there, you can mix and match weapons and their attachments. For me, this works out well as it's really easy to just hop in and out of a game, play and have fun.One nice feature is proximity voice chat/sounds. Makes it easier to tell from which direction your teammates are speaking to you from, shots are being fired from, nearby footsteps, etc.Overall, I definitely recommend this game for Co-Op play and I hear Multiplayer is a blast as well. When I purchased Insurgency, it was on sale for $4.99 and I can honestly say, it's the best use of $5 bucks I've had on Steam so far. Right now, during this autumn sale, it's going for $1.99. Seriously, at $2 I'd say it's worth at least trying it out. :)*A friendly tip for new players: The UI is unobtrusive. The game doesn't constantly remind you to reload your weapon and what not. So be mindful of how many shots you've fired or you may find yourself listening to the "click-click of death" at the worst possible times. lol

content:
Posted: October 11, 2016
Amazing game, with highly realistic HUD (very few details), great choice of weapons and assymetrical loadouts (choose your own scope, ammo type, foregrip or bipod, silencer, etc), fun game modes, in both cooperative and multiplayer, and maps are fun, if a tad repetitive. Night maps and NVG are cool, and are so much harder than day. Forces teamwork and communication, but mostly making sure you're covering your team's back and not shooting at each other in a crossfire. High tension pulse beating moments, adrenaline rushes, moments of victory, despair, and frustration. Class based combat system with different weapons available to each, and a realistic load limit. Many other features throughout, and an overall 10/10.For only $10 USD.

												1. Should you quit CS:GO/Arma for this game?      Yes.2. Why?     INTENSE, Cool maps, amazing sound effects(especially bullets flying and hiting near you, it is terrifying), nice players, different game modes, all of them are fun, realistic, nice graphics, no pay-to-wins, haven't seen any hacker so far, balanced guns and respective roles (sniper, fighter, etc), grenades hurts a lot so beware, no crashes, I am running this game in a regular laptop so don't worry about specs.3. You will die a lot in the beginning, until you get to know the map, but you will be so excited that it will not be repetitive. *Note: There is a 'hardcore mode' where you die once and that's it. Dead meat.I would recommend it to my friends but I don't have any.

content:
Posted: February 27
												It is a fps game that takes place in Iraq/Middle East. Basicly you are fighting as USA against militia. There's no much story in this game though this game is clearly better than Call Of Duty and it is way more cheaper than CoD. If you like first person shooter and if you see this game on a sale just buy it. You won't regret a thing. Well I wanna talk about some of the game features.->Realism: The lack of crosshair & HUD(where you cannot see how many bullets in your magazine etc.) is the most important part of the game thus makes the game realistic and more challenging. ->Weapons: Base weapons for classes are good and enough I think. If you don't like some guns, you can always replace any weapon in the game with mods which gives you the ability to craft your own personal armory. ->Coop: I mostly played Coop mode which is really fun with friends. I didn't encountered any toxic player in coop. Therefore I like the community of this game. ->Multiplayer: I didn't play much in multiplayer only for like 12 hours or so. I found it a little slow. If you are looking for a tactical approach in fps games, I believe you gonna like it.->Mods: You can reshape the game as much as you like. You can change Insurgents as ISIS and make them shout "Allahu Akbar" everytime they throw a RPG at you. Or make them Star Wars Clones so that they will miss every shot. As a conclusion, I like this game and I recommend to all fps lovers. I really felt like in a war while playing this game. I hope to see you guys & gals in the battlefield.

content:
Posted: March 10, 2014
												Insurgency is a solid tactical-shooter that will remind you of the good times when everyone was playing Counter Strike and modern FPS games like COD were non existent, good olâ times.One of the best things about Insurgency is the fact that you die quick, very quick, If the enemy spots you, you are dead, period. The same happens if you wonât cooperate with your teammates or wander too far across the map. Teamwork is key in this game, so you better find a bunch of friends that you can play it with, or at least get a mic and a solid pair of headphones because without them, you are in huge trouble. At first, you probably wonât notice who killed you because this is a very tactical game, everyone is hiding and waiting for the perfect moment to approach.  Insurgency will appeal to the kind of players who love tactical shooters with steep learning curve, sort of like in Counter Strike 1.6 .Insurgency started off as one of the most popular Half-Life 2 mods, but you probably already know that, because most people that I know already played Insurgency before, as in the HF2 mod.  It was downloaded over a million times ,and received the Playerâs Choice 2007 Mod of the Year award from ModDB which is a huge honor and Iâm happy that this game got released. Even though the game runs on Valveâs Source Engine, it still looks and feels like a fully-fledged release. Personally, I was expecting much less from this game, but I was pleased to see that the developer(New World Interactive) actually took the time and made it worth a while.The best way to describe Insgurgencyâs gameplay is quite difficult, itâs a mix between Counter Strike and Red Orchestra, the reason why Iâm saying that is because throughout my time with this game I felt like Iâm playing a solid tactical-shooter, it reminded me of the time when everyone played CS 1.6 which is a good thing, you have access to everything, you donât need to unlock weapons or perks, this is an old school tactical-shooter and I love it.. For those uninitiated with the world of tactical shooters, the gameplay is highly dependent upon you sticking close to your teammates, and taking control of the objectives. Most of the gameâs maps are perfect for this kind of gameplay style, small maps with many vantage points for long-range shooting and much more, youâll really appreciate the work that the developers put into the maps. The fact that the game supports up to 32 players, I have never encountered a camper during an online match, which is surprising because at first I thought everyone is just going to hide behind the cover but no, majority of players cooperate with each other, I have also noticed that the community is very supportive, this makes the online experience very enjoyable.The Feel of weaponry in Insurgency is spot on. Each gun in the game, has its own advantages and disadvantages, and they all handle differently. This is how you supposed to program guns in an online multiplayer game, Iâm talking to you Call Of Duty. You can also add different attachments to your weapons, for ex. penetrating ammo, scope and many more. The Supplies system gives you a limited number of points which prevents the player from adding all of the attachments to their weapons, for ex. adding a penetrating ammo will costs you 3 points and you have 10 in total(Iâm not sure about the precise number).What I love the most about this game is how difficult it is, and how it focuses upon tactical play and cooperation with your teammates, I havenât seen a game like Insurgency for a long time(except for CS:GO), We need more games like Insurgency, and less of the COD, modern-military bulls**t that we are overwhelmed with nowadays. If you are a huge COD fan who plays nothing but COD or Medal Of Honor, this game is probably not for you but for as little as $15 you might as well give it a try. On the other hand, If you grew up playing games like CS 1.6, get it now, you wonât be disappointed.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 11, 2015
												Insurgency is the game I always want to play. I've tried the free weekend version and I enjoyed it. So, when it's on sale, I decided to buy the 4-pack edition of the game so I can play with my friends. I never regret it at all.       Insurgency is all about teamwork, communication and pure combat skills. When you play this game for the first time, it's a breath of pure fresh air. It makes you feel like you're in real combat with adrenaline pump in all over your body.This game also feautures realistic damage, where one shot to the chest may kill you instantly, with no-kill cam whatsoever. It features multiple gamemodes and all of them requires good team coordination! Like CO-OP for example, bots are not really smart but the weapon damage bots have is the same to us, that's why they're deadly even if they are not smart. Also, the multiplayer is pure teamwork to win. There are normal gamemodes like Firefight and also interesting gamemodes like Infiltrate too.       The best part of it though, is, the workshop. I downloaded more than 20 workshop contents, like the ACR carbine, CompM4 RDS, DEVGRU uniforms and so on! There are plenty to download thanks to the great Insurgency community. However, original in-game contents are also good but workshop just adds customisation up a bit.       The downsides I found to be annoying (All in PVP gamemodes), are corner camping, like any player can basically just lay down behind a corner and just shoot you with ease when you round the corner or push in a building, however, they can be countered with good crosshair positioning and explosives. So about, explosives, they can be spammed in tight areas, which most of them are objective zones, like a house with a capture point, for example, if you're capturing it, be ready for multiple 10-meter damage radius grenades that will fly into the zone.       My conclusion is that, buy it now, realistic and hardcore FPS fans would love this game. There are tactical and realistic elements like Arma, mixed with medium paced action and objective teamplay like Battlefield. However, there are some annoying exploits or gameplay problems in PVP gamemodes but it's not game breaking. There is also a workshop full of usable in-game community items to use with too! 8.5/10

												This game is basicly mix of BF and CS:GO which is pretty good and well done (trust me you well find yourself playing this game for hours and hours and so on...) but one thing that made me mad is the controller support...which is annoying to me because it says here this game is controller support, which is not! all i can do is just move and that's all, really (controller support my butt) but still disbite the controller support I will forgive this game (because fun). but if you guys are going using a controller for this game don't bother even try, it's not like they going to fix it or anything but if you willing to put up with keyboard then good for you. plus if you looking for challange which is: no spotting, no hip-fire crosshair, no minimap, no killcam, no health meter, no hit/ kill notification, not even an ammo counter then this game is for you. number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 15, 2015
												So... This is my review for Insurgency: 80% / 100%Gameplay: In co-op you can use in-game commands like "Moving/Supressing Fire/Requesting Grenade" .Equipment-Wise - Armor/5 Weapons for each class/Pistols/Grenades/C4/RPG/Night Googles/Vests. Maps - about 10 co-op maps, which can be played in Hunt mode / Survival Mode / Checkpoint mode.There is no cover system (Cuz it's FPS) but you can take cover behind walls/random cars or hiding spots while you are getting ambushed or over-run by the enemy.I enjoy the co-op everytime I play Insurgency (You need to find good tactical team-mates to play with tho :) ) (8/10)Gameplay Styles: You can either rambo and rush through the map while killing enemies (not recommended) or work as a team in co-op and experience the tactical expect of the game (using voice coms and in-game commands).There is also pvp mode with ladders  and zombie mode. (7.5/10)Graphics: The graphics fit the game itself cuz it still needs some updates so the graphics are good enough.There is gore, fire effects and grenade/smoke effects. (6/10)Sounds: Weapon sounds are loud, Silencers have their silenced sounds so you can know if a player is using a SD gun or not.In-game commands included with character voice so it's enjoyable using the commands. (8/10)Enjoyment: (8.5/10)Repetetive: (3/10) - Enemy is randomly places, there are 4-5 difficulties, enemy is challenging to some points as well.Frustraiton (4/10) - Getting killed out of nowhere or way too fast, getting rpg'ed in the face out of nowhere.Boredom (4/10)

content:
Posted: April 20, 2015
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.In all seriousness, buy taliban simulator 2015 now.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2014
												Thought process of a Newb:Cool menu music, but where do I customize my character? Coop or PvP? Coop is for losers, PvP all the way! K/D 0:32. NOPE! Freaking cheating campers and aimbots and hacking and hmph $%#@... (indistinguishable)What's a supply point? Better spend it on flashbangs and smoke grenades, then my teammates will like me!Who needs a secondary? All I need is an M16 and meh skillz! Hey, where's the bullet counter? How come I reload and the mag only has 2 bullets left in it? Broken game! Where's my health meter? He only hit me once! HACKS! And why can't I hit anything but my teammates!Man, these bots are hard, but I least I know that I can kill 1 for every time I die. That's pretty good, right? Wait, how do I pick up stuff from off the floor? And I how do I turn NVGs on? Also, how do you slide like that? Also also, why am I ALWAYS THE FIRST TO DIE? RPG!Another RPG! Flashbang! Sorry! Smoke out! What? Bots can see through smoke? Hacks! Watch out, I'm throwing a grenade! It's not my fault, someone put a wall there. (Red vs Blue, anybody? No? Sigh) Stop shining what in your eyes? Well, how do I turn it off? Where are the keybindings?Ok, I don't get it. I'm standing on D, and it's not capturing! Stop yelling at me! I don't have a any grenades! On the ground? Where? I can't see it! Ressuply where? Ok, I'll be right back! (Throws a smoke grenade at cache)I like this game, it's realistic and hard. It took me 20 hours, but I think I'm finally getting the hang of this. I'm not sucking so badly, and I'm not always in last place. Hey, wait a second, how is he getting a K/D of 100:1? (checks profile) 200 hours of gametime! Holy crap! He also has 2, 000 hours of Team Fortress 2, and 4, 000 hours of DOTA 2! I can't compete with him!200 hours later, OWNS ALL. Mwahahahaha. Then plays with guys with 400 hours plus gametime. CRAP!

												A very solid game. I liked very much that it was easy to pick up (unlike other realistic fps games that can drive you nuts with the controls). So you can pretty much jump straight in. The gameplay is highly tactical and relatively slow paced - this is certainly not Counter Strike. It can be played as both a pvp game and a coop game vs bots. For our group, it was the coop aspect that everyone seemed to prefer.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												so far i've played 2 hours and i'd like to write a review.Insurgency is meant to capture what real counter-insurgency feels like from the comfort of your desk. The game feels like an Andy McNab book. As far as optimization goes, it is golden, my little i3 laptop can get about 30 fps on it with a medium-high graphics settings. I've only played 2 hours but I learnt one thing, this game has never heard the phrase, "bullet sponge", 1 shot to the right place, and it's light  out for you. Co-op, took 5 map rotations and there are about 10 rounds in a rotation, just to get 1 victory! this game has no hud, except it tells you how many mags you have left. I managed to get second on the scoreboard first time I played it, I told my team of veteran players that they can  crouvh behind cover, suddenly I went to the bottom of the scoreboard. Also first time I joined a match I was greeted by and asian kid with his mic lodged in his throat.This is a great game and after 2 hours I definetly think it is worth buying.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 11, 2016
Amazing game, with highly realistic HUD (very few details), great choice of weapons and assymetrical loadouts (choose your own scope, ammo type, foregrip or bipod, silencer, etc), fun game modes, in both cooperative and multiplayer, and maps are fun, if a tad repetitive. Night maps and NVG are cool, and are so much harder than day. Forces teamwork and communication, but mostly making sure you're covering your team's back and not shooting at each other in a crossfire. High tension pulse beating moments, adrenaline rushes, moments of victory, despair, and frustration. Class based combat system with different weapons available to each, and a realistic load limit. Many other features throughout, and an overall 10/10.For only $10 USD.

DLC either.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												I can only speak for the Co-Op (PvE) game play as I have yet to try Multiplayer (PvP). It's been a lot of fun playing Insurgency Co-Op. I wasn't sure what to think of it going in as it's not exactly the newest game out there, but I'm glad I decided to give it a try. The community has been very friendly and helpful. There are five different game modes in Co-Op to suit different tastes and play styles. A lot of different maps to play on, many with nighttime versions (bring on the night vision!). Not to mention a whole lot more great custom maps made by the community. This game lends itself well to playing cooperatively with other players and it's a ton of fun to work towards the same goals together. There isn't any character progression meaning weapons to unlock or skills. Just whatever load out you choose from a list of classes and weapons. From there, you can mix and match weapons and their attachments. For me, this works out well as it's really easy to just hop in and out of a game, play and have fun.One nice feature is proximity voice chat/sounds. Makes it easier to tell from which direction your teammates are speaking to you from, shots are being fired from, nearby footsteps, etc.Overall, I definitely recommend this game for Co-Op play and I hear Multiplayer is a blast as well. When I purchased Insurgency, it was on sale for $4.99 and I can honestly say, it's the best use of $5 bucks I've had on Steam so far. Right now, during this autumn sale, it's going for $1.99. Seriously, at $2 I'd say it's worth at least trying it out. :)*A friendly tip for new players: The UI is unobtrusive. The game doesn't constantly remind you to reload your weapon and what not. So be mindful of how many shots you've fired or you may find yourself listening to the "click-click of death" at the worst possible times. lol

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 27
												It is a fps game that takes place in Iraq/Middle East. Basicly you are fighting as USA against militia. There's no much story in this game though this game is clearly better than Call Of Duty and it is way more cheaper than CoD. If you like first person shooter and if you see this game on a sale just buy it. You won't regret a thing. Well I wanna talk about some of the game features.->Realism: The lack of crosshair & HUD(where you cannot see how many bullets in your magazine etc.) is the most important part of the game thus makes the game realistic and more challenging. ->Weapons: Base weapons for classes are good and enough I think. If you don't like some guns, you can always replace any weapon in the game with mods which gives you the ability to craft your own personal armory. ->Coop: I mostly played Coop mode which is really fun with friends. I didn't encountered any toxic player in coop. Therefore I like the community of this game. ->Multiplayer: I didn't play much in multiplayer only for like 12 hours or so. I found it a little slow. If you are looking for a tactical approach in fps games, I believe you gonna like it.->Mods: You can reshape the game as much as you like. You can change Insurgents as ISIS and make them shout "Allahu Akbar" everytime they throw a RPG at you. Or make them Star Wars Clones so that they will miss every shot. As a conclusion, I like this game and I recommend to all fps lovers. I really felt like in a war while playing this game. I hope to see you guys & gals in the battlefield.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 2, 2016
												My views of this Game.Essentially my way of telling if a game is good is asking myself, have I at any point in this game felt like Sniper Jackson from Saving Private Ryan? The answer for this game, where it's not set in WW2 to be fair, is definately yes. When you are sniping on Buhriz and picking off enemies one by one and calling strats and giving support to your team it is a gameplay experience only comparable to the Likes of Arma 3 and other tactical shooters. This paired with the superb combat mechanics, tense gameplay and excellent weapon balancing means I  would definately recommend this smasher of a game.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												**GAME START**RPG to the faceDead**RESPAWN**AK to the face from 200 yardsDead **RESPAWN**Molotov in a small crowded roomAll deadI've never died so often or so cinematically in another game, and yet i can't get enough. Imagine ArmA and COD had a love child... this is pretty close to how it would turn out. You get the playability and in some sense the pace of Call of Duty, with the ever-present fear of impending death from a well put together ArmA mission. Run and gun works in some situations, but more often than not a good solid bit of squad based teamwork is the way forward - and the people i've played with so far have been team playersYes there are bugs, and sometimes they frustrate... You can plug an entire clip into an enemy without blunting his accuracy - you'll still get an AK to the face. But the sheer tension and ultimate satisfaction that comes from a win make up for it. And i'm sure this game still has a lot to give anyway.Highly recommend if you're in to squad play and don't mind dying. A lot.AK to the faceDead

content:
Posted: June 29, 2016
												1. Should you quit CS:GO/Arma for this game?      Yes.2. Why?     INTENSE, Cool maps, amazing sound effects(especially bullets flying and hiting near you, it is terrifying), nice players, different game modes, all of them are fun, realistic, nice graphics, no pay-to-wins, haven't seen any hacker so far, balanced guns and respective roles (sniper, fighter, etc), grenades hurts a lot so beware, no crashes, I am running this game in a regular laptop so don't worry about specs.3. Downsides?     If you play it like a fool, it will repetitive since you are going to die every 30 seconds and then wait 30 seconds to 'respawn' in some modes. You will die a lot in the beginning, until you get to know the map, but you will be so excited that it will not be repetitive. *Note: There is a 'hardcore mode' where you die once and that's it. Dead meat.I would recommend it to my friends but I don't have any.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2015
												Tactical, intense, and great gunplay can really help describe how I feel about this game.  It takes the best of what I love from many different FPS games and brings it together.  I've spent a lot of time in PVP and enjoy the hunt as well as Co op with the different styles of game play such as bullet time.   The game is unforgiving if you try and play it like an arena based run n gun FPS game. You'll need to approach this game as its own beast and give it a chance.  I think at this price you'd do yourself a diservice if you didn't give it a try.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2016
												Great game, has a good potency of realism yet is still fast paced enough to keep the flow of action. The game makes you rely on instincts (no indication of enemy location, no magazine count, no mini map, just instinct.) It also subtly forces you to work with your teammates instead of going lone wolf. Weather it be coop or pvp you must rely on communication with your team mates or else face losing. Overall I would highly recommend this game for someone wishing to break away from major FPS titles such as Battlefield and Call of Duty. My ONLY complaint about this game so far is how privately owned servers are allowed to monetize their ads. Now don't get me wrong, if a person wishes to host a server they should have the right to monetize it to gain revenue so that they can keep the server running, what I don't like is how the ads uncontrollably BLARE from my speakers. Yes...The ads that play upon entering a server will blare at full volume, and there is no way to turn it off or turn it down. This is a highly obnoxious way of flaunting about an ad, and makes it so I cannot hear anything else until the ad is done playing. Again, as I mentioned before, monetizing a serve is okay, but it should be done in a more subtle way.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 26, 2016
												Insurgency doesn't pretend to be something it isn't. It's a no-frills, no BS first person shooter. No unlocking guns, everything is balanced and there's an assortment of maps of varying sizes. There's a variety of gamemodes. There's no vehicles and everyone has equal opportunity. There's several classes that you can play to fill your role on the battlefield. What's more, there's new content coming out for the game constantly and is always free and immediately available to use. Plus you can use the Steam Workshop to personalize the game to make it your own.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2014
												Incredible tactical and realistic shooter. I am not the greatest at FPS, and quit playing many FPS games years ago shortly after CS became stand alone from HL mod. If you are looking for CoD 2.0, leave now and don't pay for it... you'll jus get annoyed when you try to sprint straight into the enemy respawn area and get gunned down by the entire team at once. Mind you, it'll only take about 2 of the 50 bullets that will hit you to ensure you die... if not just one. However, if you are looking for something that will challenge you both as a solo player and a group friendly player, take this one up. This game has definitely renewed my faith in the FPS saga.Tactical shooter is a bit of an understatement. It's probably one of the more realistic shooters on the market at this time. Pull the trigger once or twice while the weapons on the player, you're going to get the kill. Doesnt take a full clip to slaughter someone, or have them turn and sprint + knife at the same time (coughs... COD).No hud, no map, no bs. Just your sights, a couple mags, and your team. You'll get a quick glance at how many mags you got (for about 2-3 seconds) or grenades when you weapon swap - thats about it. Sounds also are very realistic. It is hard to find a game that actually includes a bullet crack when one zips too close to your head (as it does in real life). The gun sounds are comparable to the weapon counter parts as well.Graphically, I see no room to complain. Gameplay - I am still learning the different types of modes and the maps, but the game is solid. I barely hit any buggy issues like my bullets magically vanishing when I shoot at a person, or the wall disappearing and I fall through the game.. I will say you will be forced to learn the maps, its neccessary to get any type of advantage. And those advantages, you'll need em. I love the fact that with 1-2 shots a player is down and out, none of this 15+ 5.56mm bullets to kill one man... Overall I give this a 9/10 - and I would DEFINITELY recommend buying this if you desire a challenging FPS that is fun and fair.

												Tactical, intense, and great gunplay can really help describe how I feel about this game.  It takes the best of what I love from many different FPS games and brings it together.  I've spent a lot of time in PVP and enjoy the hunt as well as Co op with the different styles of game play such as bullet time.   The game is unforgiving if you try and play it like an arena based run n gun FPS game. You'll need to approach this game as its own beast and give it a chance.  I think at this price you'd do yourself a diservice if you didn't give it a try.

content:
Posted: February 22
												I know that I haven't played this game for too long, but I just love it, so I feel like writing this review.First of all, you can get this game pretty cheap on summer sale or winter sale so that's a bonus.Second, if you are into hardcore military fps shooters, that's for you.The classes, the teams, the maps, the guns, are just really well made and the sound really gets your attention, atleast it did for me.The only thing they can do to improve the game is to change the way you buy your weapons, I mean, you can buy the weapons just from a specific class, not all the guns available in your team. They could make a gamemode where there are no classes (just a limit for snipers, rocketeers, etc, in a team) and you can buy any guns you want and are available in your team or even looking into changing the whole buying system.With all of that being said it is a enjoyable game, I haven't encountered any bug that can change my gameplay in any ways, so that's another bonus.I really recommend the game, and as I said, if you get it on a sale it's perfect, but I can say that even the whole price is worth it if you enjoy this type of games. I really recommend buying it. 8/10.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												Insurgency is a great game. It makes you feel like one of your kills might actually help your team. Your kills have weight, and they arent just like one person you mowed down in call of duty. It is a tactical game, but is relatively easy to learn. The point system adds a unique way of customizing your soldier, and the role system makes you feel like a sniper when your a sniper. The point system also negates excessive farming for weapons, and lets all new players unlock all the guns. Also, the game doesnt have a horrible commmunity (in my opinion) and great developers who know what there doing. I recommend Insurgency for everyone!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												This is one of the few games that I will actually take the time to do a review on. Why? Because its freaking amazing!! The aim of this game is to provide combat realism, but not have overly long, drawn out and occasionally boring scenarios such as in ArmA (Arma's still a heck of a lot of fun though, check that game out too!).This game has stunning graphics, seriously. It reminds me of an action movie- and it plays like one too! The game can also provide lots of ambience that matches right with whats going on. I was playing a game with bots- I was the last man standing with 0 waves left on my team and two left on the enemies. I had to sneak around the map, camping corners and carefully sniping all the enemy team mates. That moment was incredibly suspenseful- I was on the edge of my seat the entire time, and any time a bullet flew near me, I'd jump back in my seat despite myself.The larger firefights are really cool too. Most of the maps are medium sized, allowing for longer-distance engagements as well as close quarters, action packed adrenaline filled spray-and-pray scenarios. Each match is a little different from the next, providing a TON of replayability. I'd reccomend it to anyone into milsim like shooters.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 14, 2015
												A slow-paced, realistic, team-oriented military style shooter.Some key points:Slow paced gameplay, sprinting around to meet an opponent with their gun drawn will likely end badly.Excellent sound design with realistic audio - Bullet cracks flying past you, impact noises and soldiers on the battlefield yelling as they are suppressed.Equipment management with limited supply, balance out your strategy before a fight.Realistic damage modelling - You will likely get killed with 1 bullet. First to land the hit wins the gunfight.Limited HUD, save for compass. No ammo kount, most servers have no killfeed.Easy to get into, difficult to master.The most enjoyable games where you have to work as a team to win.I would highly recommend this, very nice to unwind to, or to wreak havoc.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												CAUTION: THIS GAME IS NOTHING LIKE COD OR BATTLEFIELD. YOU WON'T DIE FROM A KNIFE KILL AFTER EMPTYING THE WHOLE MAG INTO THE ENEMY.Here we go, lots of amazing things:   Very nice community, they never call you a noob or say they've f*cked you're mom (unlike COD).   Fast AND Slow paced game. You want to capture points fast, so that you get more ' waves' or your team mates respawn or you win the game, but you always have to slow down and check the tiniest bit of detail to prevent you form dying. number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												I'm very impressed with this game.First off, Insurgency is very entertaining. Easy to learn and boasting a wide variety of gameplay options, the game is both simple and complex. Situations vary from drawn out, long range battles to quick, almost twitch-shooter style firefights. Sometimes you need to destroy an object, sometimes capture one, and sometimes just kill as many enemies as you can. In addition to the standard pvp gamemodes, Insurgency adds a few of its own, as well as a coop gamemode that's fantastic for learning the ropes and practicing against bots while still getting a feel for multiplayer.Insurgency is on the upper half of the scale as far as realism goes. The minimalistic HUD and the way the gun handles creates a very immersive experience, and the game has a million little touches that work wonders to keep that immersion going, from the way your gun wavers when fatigued to the way that firing from the hip requires you to actually aim the gun at the enemy, not just position them in the middle of your screen and click. High damage from guns means that you can't go charging into battle like some sort of adrenaline-high Call-of-Duty bullet sponge, and keeps combat drawn out and deliberate, favoring a playstyle of firing slow, well-aimed shots instead of spraying everywhere. That's not to say it's INCREDIBLY realistic - Healing from gunshot wounds in a matter of seconds, improbable aiming skills, and the like - but it definitely isn't Counter-Strike or Call of Duty.The game boasts a tag of "tactical" and it earns it. While I wouldn't say it requires you to make larger strategic decisions, outside of "what point should I go to," and "what's the safest and fastest way to get there?" it does require you to make smart decisions both inside and outside of a firefight. "Is this the best place I could be standing?" "Knowing my skill, can I expect myself to cover all three of these entrances or should I risk losing ground to limit the number of directions enemies can come from?" "Can I handle this point by myself, or should I call for support?" In combat, you'll be expected to make good choices to stay alive, even if they're as simple as, "Is it safe to poke my head out now?"On another note, the community for this game is great. Usually, you'd expect "the internet" and "cooperation" to go together about as well as oil and politics, but the players I've met so far were very nice. We all have a good laugh when we get obliterated, and we all congratulate each other when a teammate pulls off an unexpected victory. More experienced or skilled players are quick to provide helpful advice. When a player sees a role that needs to be filled, they're quick to jump into it. So far, I haven't met any real â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥â¥s, and while a few people take the game a bit seriously, the mic chat is free of 12 year olds threatening to do terrible things to my mother. Even our squeakers are friendly.Overall, I highly recommend this game to anybody who enjoys FPS games like Counter-Strike, but would like something slower and more thoughtful.

content:
Posted: June 9, 2014
												The game plays out very well. Its, its own game in it self, I've not seen any like it (Gamemode wise). But it still has a feel of counter strike to it, and in my mind that is not a bad thing as I also love Counter Strike. I'd say its an Upgraded version of Counter Strike, but thats just me.In most game modes, if you die, a team mate will need to catch an enemy objective. It is like Search and Destroy from the Call of Duty franchice, but you can respawn by one of the team mates at least doing the objective for a change. It is a very team based game, as there are a lot of firefights. May it be in a street or a hallway, you always need your team there to back you up. So if you are the last one alive you can sneek over and take an objective, and all of your team will respawn. Not only things like that but the gun play is really realistic, as you can shoot at an enemy... And he will actually die, rather than having to be shot 15 times before he dies. The game overall is very realistic in my mind, as when you shoot your gun it creates smoke at the end of your barrel, and varies depending on what gun it is. You can also shoot at the ground, and instead of an odd bullet hole, a huge pile of dust (Wether you are on a snow map or a sand map, you will get snow or sand). Cover is quite a critical thing in this game, as if you are shot more than once, you will most likely die. I hope the review was to your liking... I have only explained some of the minor things in the game, there is so much more to it.10/10Have fun! (If you buy it of course)

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Holy Moly. This game has come very far! I loved it when it was a mod, and now I love it even more.The overall feeling of the weapons is highly believable, it takes just one shot take down an enemy. Suppression effects are marvellous and make you eager to just suppress an enemy with rapid fire while your buddy (Who you should have some kind of voice communication with) goes in and flanks him. Teamwork is easily created!The bullet impact effects are also very subtle and help add to the fear of death in this game. Very good. The ragdoll effects are far from the comical exploding and flying through the air effects, instead dead targets instantly fall to the ground and remain there.The UI is minimalistic, you have no idea about your ammo count, except when you count your bullets. You can modify your weapons with all kinds of attachments, especially on the "Security" side, while the Insurgents mostly field WW2 equipment. (I saw an MP40!)The maps/levles/areas are highly detailed and made with a lot of love. The audio effects used in those maps add to immersion even further. And all the equipment and vehicles that are used (static, not useable) are accurate to the era.So this game is all in all amazing, and in my opinion the next "Red Orchestra". So if you are into realistic firefights, this game is gold.From a gamer's perpective I give this 9/10. It didn't make the 10/10 because most servers currently lag and this causes a jittery visual to all the animations.

content:
Posted: June 2, 2014
												Insurgency is a great MP-based hardcore tactical CQB FPS that has perfectly combined gameplay elements and ideas inspired by older FPS titles such as Counter-Strike, Ghost Recon, Red Orchestra and from the older Battlefield game titles as well which gives us, the players, such a great gaming experience like no other game does out there. Teamwork is very essential in this game, having a microphone is a must as well to have that 100% game experience and you have to rely on your team mates to complete all task objectives in order to win or by killing all enemy combatants.I can assure you that it feels very rewarding when doing an objective or defending the control points by keeping the enemy team at bay, it also helps a lot being a total team-player by helping to spot enemy positions and informing your team of so for a counterattack and the best of all is using your brain to outsmart the enemy and use different tactics to flank them, lure them in for the kill or set up a nice trap for your team to finish the job.A tip that I highly recommend when playing this game is to make sure you have killed & cleared the objective area point of enemy forces by searching for dead bodies when a firefight is over and communicate over all with your team for intel, since there's no kill-cam/kill confirmation feedback that tells you so (default/official NWI servers) and I highly do recommend all of you to get this game if you are truly tired of the dumbed-down games that has affected this generation of FPS games for a long time, such games as CoD or the latest BF games that pampers to casual, mainstream no skill players that only enjoy brainless gameplay, overpriced & game breaking DLC, stupid unlocks and the recycled garbage for every single year.Cheers! and see ya' all in the front-lines of Insurgency.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 29, 2014
												First off. I love this game, couldnt recommend it highly enough. I really hope this game gets the attention it deserves. Its honestly really well made and balanced. This game is a great throwback to games that actually made your heart race. Theres an andrenaline rush that comes with winning a round or killing your foe in a 1v1. Thats a feeling that i think has gone missing in a lot of titles. Especially the AAA ones... this will bring you back (or introduce you) to the feeling of being in a competitive match in CS1.6. I like the fact that there isnt a crazy amount of guns in the game. Just your basics, AK 47 ak47u, m16, ar15, m9 makarov, mp40, benelli, m24, mpk5 ump45 and mosin nagant. So youre thinking, thats no good. Where is the variety? But trust me, each gun feels unique enough to find a favorite and all the weapons will put your foe on his bum if you master them. Sniping feels crisp. The recoil in the game is also better than any modern military shooter out there. (ive tried them all) and it makes for awesome firefights that actually make you feel like youre in the midst of a battle. it has a learning curve, but that is welcomed. Now a days games are just pick up and play, and just about any idiot can get a crazy kill streak and wipe out your whole team. Not so here. You will have to work for those kills. That being said. Im glad. If you want another point and click fps. Look elsewhere. If you want something refreshing, thrill inducing but still bringing fps back to their basics, this is the game for you. Give it a chance, for 15 bucks, you seriously cant go wrong. All that being said, see you in the hellfire soldier.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												I've seen someone write this into a review so I thought I would add it. This game is what would happen if FPS breeding goes haywire. It's like Rainbow Six had a baby with Red Orchestra and their nanny was Counter Strike. It is simply one of the best FPS game of our time. Quick, tactical gameplay with team coordination and realistic outcomes. 1-2 bullets to kill and the best feeling shooting of ANY FPS game. That is high praise. Considering this game released right into the firing line (Gun Pun) of the likes of CS:GO and Arma. The controls are tight and responsive but still simulating your characters weight. The graphics and video quality are tremendous. There are some slight glithces here and there but it is very good looking. Everything in the game just feels good. I would like to have a way to walk instead of walking quickly so it disguises your footsteps and maybe have a way to blind fire whilst leaning towards a corner to lay down surpressing fire as supression is a big part of this game. A solid 9/10 for me and I recommend that you buy it, If you are into FPS/Mil Sim games like I am. Thanks for reading!

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
												Graphics:  It's a source game, as such it's not exactly a benchmark game.  Having said that, the game has a lot of nice touches that I don't see in most games like smoke trails coming from the end of your barrel after firing, gun smoke projection during firing, and seeing not only whether my teammates flashlight is on, but where it's landing in the environment.Gameplay:  Low health and limitied/no respawns (depending on game mode) combine to offer a much slower, less hectic combat experience.  An experience that I thouroughly enjoy, but it's not for everyone.  I've never seen non-lethal gernade types be so important in a modern combat game than in Insurgency (flash, smoke) and that's refreshing to see.  The game is built around a supply point system that the players use to purchase the gear they'll be using in the match, not completely unlike Counter Strike, but you don't lose all your stuff when you die.  They give you enough supply points that you can be decently kitted out, but you won't be able to get everything you want, so you'll have to think hard about what you can do without.Overall:  I'm really over the moon about this game.  The slower combat experience from Insurgency is unlike anything I've experienced prior.  I came for the COOP, but ended up staying for the competative multiplayer.  I've always liked objective based games, but lately the past two battlefield titles left me disappointed.  I felt they were far too hectic, too much going on for me to get any kind of teamwork going between me and my friends.  The community is small but dedicated, and I've never had trouble finding a populated match.  This is a classic case of quality over quantity, the developers priced it very well considering the amount of content there currently is, and they are working on producing more.  I'm very excited for Insurgency, and I think it will have a bright future.

content:
Posted: June 11, 2014
												Great Game! If you appreciate tactical shooters with loads of realistic mechanics look no further.  From the rounds snapping over your head to the blistering shellshock of a well placed grenade, Insurgency keeps it simple, fresh and intense as hell.  The weapon customization is balanced and innovative with many game changing attachments that suit your unique playstyle.  The minimal UI, no minimap and lack of hit indicators elevate the intensity with no real method of knowing you eliminated your target or where your opposition might be hiding; while also giving you an element of stealth that evade most AAA titles. Lastly, it's as flashy as it needs to be while delivering smooth unadulterated violence right to the comfort of your own home.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
												Insurgency is the most intense and realistic shooter I've played in a while.No hitmarkers, no killfeeds, no ammo counts, no health bar, no crosshairs. Just a magazine counter, a timer, and your objectives.The main gamemode (and pretty much the only gamemode I play) is a bit like TF2's control point gamemode, except with more points to capture, and some of them needing to be destroyed.The combat can get scary, bullets whirring past you, only inches away from killing you. You shoot someone, and your only indicator of his death is his corpse on the ground.It's especially fun with friends, or even just good teammates. Having good coordination and strategy is key to this game.I've heard this game is a lot like Red Orchestra, but I haven't played that game, so I wouldn't know. But if you're a fan of games like that, I'd suggest buying this game.

content:
Posted: February 13, 2014
What Other Shooters Should Be Aiming ForI remember when COD:BO came out, I was a fan of the hardcore and barebones game modes. There was no option to play hardcore barebones though. You had to choose between one or the other. I remember thinking, "wouldn't it be nice if they had a hardcore barebones game mode". Even though this game has weapon attatchments, this for me is as close as it gets.With kills taking only 1-2 shots from your mag, it feels almost more like a paintball game in comparison to other shooters i've played. The guns in insurgency feel and sound great too. Gun fights are intense in the sense that you have no hit markers and no way to tell if you killed the person other than a visual confirmation. So popping your head out for that second look could mean death, or that you're clear to advance. Something else thats nice about this game is that the  rich don't get richer . Unlike most other popular shooters, there is no leveling system to unlock guns/attachments and increase character stats. And for ingame there are no killsteaks. This is a game that focuses more on the core game mechanics than visual polish. In short, if you are looking for a shooter that has a realistic feel and is tactical, i highly recommend this game.
